quotes.message: Be patient and tough; someday this pain will be useful to you.
quotes.name: Ovid

quotes.message: Healing yourself is connected with healing others.
quotes.name: Yoko Ono

quotes.message: Get over it. Get on with your life.

quotes.message: You don't get over it. You move past it. You move through it. You lose yourself to find it, and when found, it's yours and no longer theirs.

quotes.message: Get over it - If you have a bad workout or run a bad race, allow yourself exactly 1 hour to stew about it-then move on.

quotes.message: Don't get stuck with the thing that ruins your day. Smile and be happy. Life is too short to be wasted on negative thinking.

quotes.message: You can't change what has already happened so don't waste your time thinking about it. Move on, let go, and get over it.

quotes.message: I think that everybody needs somebody to really look up to and know that even though you're going through a tough time, you'll get over it.

quotes.message: Recovery is something that you have to work on every single day and it's something that it doesn't get a day off.
quotes.name: Demi Lovato

quotes.message: I've always believed that if you don't stay moving, they will throw dirt on you.
quotes.name: Paul Anka

quotes.message: Some of think that holding on makes us strong, but sometimes it's letting go.
quotes.name: Herman Hesse

quotes.message: Get a grip, get a life, and get over it.

quotes.message: I had turned away from the picture and was going back to the world where events move, men change, light flickers, life flows in a clear stream, no matter whether over mud or over stones.
quotes.name: Joseph Conrad

quotes.message: All love gets over, and we must get over it.
quotes.name: Daniel Handler

quotes.message: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
quotes.name: Kenji Miyazawa

quotes.message: If you keep telling the same sad small story, you will keep living the same sad small life.
quotes.name: Jean Houston

quotes.message: Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars: you have to let go at some point in order to move forward.

quotes.message: Cry me a river, build a bridge, and get over it.

quotes.message: Get over it and get started, life is too short to hesitate.
quotes.name: Blaze Olamiday

quotes.message: Get mad, then get over it.

quotes.message: Get over it - Life isn't Supposed to be fair. Get over yourself, and be of service to others.

quotes.message: I decided I can't pay a person to rewind time, so I may as well get over it.

quotes.message: You were many wonderful things to many people before you met him--don't let this one event define who you are.

quotes.message: There are some things that you'll never get over, but if you use all of your strength there's nothing that you can't get through.

quotes.message: Sometimes people let the same problem make them miserable for years when they could just say, 'So what.' That's one of my favorite things to say. So what.
quotes.name: Andy Warhol

quotes.message: Try not to resist the changes that come your way. Instead, let life live through you. And do not worry that your life is turning upside down. How do you know that the side you are used to is better than the one to come.
quotes.name: Rumi

quotes.message: It is time for me to let go of my old beliefs about how relationships are supposed to be.
quotes.name: Louise Hay

quotes.message: You must make a decision that you are going to move on. It won’t happen automatically. You will have to rise up and say, ‘I don’t care how hard this is, I don’t care how disappointed I am, I’m not going to let this get the best of me. I’m moving on with my life.
quotes.name: Joel Osteen

quotes.message: He loved me. He loved me, but he doesn’t love me anymore, and it’s not the end of the world.
quotes.name: Jennifer Weiner

quotes.message: You may have a fresh start any moment you choose, for this thing that we call ‘failure’ is not the falling down, but the staying down.
quotes.name: Mary Pickford

quotes.message: What’s broken is broken — and I’d rather remember it as it was than mend it and see the broken places as long as I lived.
quotes.name: Margaret Mitchell

quotes.message: Don’t allow someone not worth it to have the power to occupy your thoughts.
quotes.name: Donna Lynn Hope

quotes.message: You’ve got to make a conscious choice every day to shed the old – whatever “the old” means for you.
quotes.name: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quotes.message: I think there comes a point where you have to grow up and get over yourself, lighten up…and forgive.
quotes.name: Jennifer Aniston

quotes.message: What's done is done.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: There will be times when it seems that it would be best to just call him and see how he's doing. Don't deceive yourself, you don't care about how he's doing, you're just craving him, don't do it. You'll only hurt yourself.

quotes.message: Some people don't realize what they have until it's gone, but that does not always mean they are supposed to get it back.
quotes.name: Stephan Labossiere

quotes.message: If Paris is the setting for a romance, New York is the perfect city in which to get over one, to get over anything. Here the lost douceur de vivre is forgotten and the intoxication of living takes over.

quotes.message: When you reach 95, after you get over your surprise, you start looking back.

quotes.message: I'm not an Uncle Tom.. I'm going to be here for forty years. For those who don't like it, get over it.

quotes.message: A slip of the foot you may soon recover, but a slip of the tongue you may never get over.

quotes.message: Look ahead and move on, but be totally in the present.
quotes.name: Sukan Sethi

quotes.message: Don't dwell on who let you down, dwell on who helped you back up.

quotes.message: See that any time you feel pained or defeated, it is only because you insist on clinging to what doesn't work. Dare to let go and you won't lose a thing except for a punishing idea.

quotes.message: Don't dwell on what went wrong. Instead focus on what to do next.
quotes.name: Dimz Media

quotes.message: Most fear is just bad management of our own mental faculties. Get over it.

quotes.message: 90% of what's stressing you today will be irrelevant in a year. Get over it. Move on and enjoy your life.

quotes.message: Don’t tell someone to get over it. Help them get through it.

quotes.message: Leaders spend 5 percent of their time on the problem and 95 percent of their time on the solution.

quotes.message: In fact, it may even be necessary to confront defeat. It might be necessary to get over it; all the way through it; and go on...

quotes.message: Why would anyone want to get over the one thing you hope for from the minute you're born and remember until the day you die?
quotes.name: Arvide Abernathy

quotes.message: I know it hurts sometimes but you'll get over it . You'll find another life to live . I swear that you'll get over it . I know you're sad and tired . You've got nothing left to give . You'll find another life to live . I know that you'll get over it.
quotes.name: Don Cannon; Ivision Smith; Anthony Michael West; etal.

quotes.message: As my heart is slowly ripping into pieces . Disconnecting from the circuits of my mind . You'll get over it you say in time . In time? . If the clocks are black absorbing everything but . A remembering how we made it that . Clocks are black . You say get over it if 50 is the new black, . hooray this could be your lucky day . But my cables they are surging almost . overloading as you disengage.
quotes.name: Myra Ellen Tori Amos

quotes.message: The question of societal fairness is always pertinent.
quotes.name: Martin Schulz

quotes.message: Lack of fairness to an opponent is essentially a sign of weakness.

quotes.message: Our sense of fairness tells us that people should pay for the wrong they do.
quotes.name: Lewis B. Smedes

quotes.message: A man who deals in fairness with his own, he can make manifest justice in the state.

quotes.message: Some people believe that fairness comes with obeying the rules. I'm one of those people.

quotes.message: Fairness does not mean everyone gets the same. Fairness means everyone gets what they need.

quotes.message: Fairness is not an attitude. It's a professional skill that must be developed and exercised.

quotes.message: It wasn't fair, but fairness was something you had to go get; it wasn't delivered like the mail.

quotes.message: Fairness is giving all people the treatment they earn and deserve. It doesn't mean treating everyone alike.

quotes.message: If we expect others to rely on our fairness and justice we must show that we rely on their fairness and justice.

quotes.message: Fair means everyone gets what they need. And the only way to get what you need is to make it happen yourself.

quotes.message: My own mother always taught me that fairness was a family value - I think equal pay is about fairness for everyone.

quotes.message: Fairness means not to use fraud and trickery in the exchange of commodities and services and the exchange of feelings.

quotes.message: Fairness is an across-the-board requirement for all our interactions with each other ...Fairness treats everbody the same.

quotes.message: The Universe is about maintaining balance, not fairness. It is by means of balance that true fairness exists in the Universe.

quotes.message: These men ask for just the same thing, fairness, and fairness only. This, so far as in my power, they, and all others, shall have.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: The universe had an odd sense of fairness; it took away things one did not want to give up, and then gave things one did not ask for.

quotes.message: Fairness forces you - even when you're writing a piece highly critical of, say, genetically modified food, as I have done - to make sure you represent the other side as extensively and as accurately as you possibly can.

quotes.message: Free people can treat each other justly, but they can't make life fair. To get rid of the unfairness among individuals, you have to exercise power over them. The more fairness you want, the more power you need. Thus, all dreams of fairness become dreams of tyranny in the end.

quotes.message: Fairness is a concept that holds only in limited situations. Yet we want the concept to extend to everything, in and out of phase. From snails to hardware stores to married life. Maybe no one finds it, or even misses it, but fairness is like love. What is given has nothing to do with what we seek.
quotes.name: Haruki Murakami

quotes.message: I don't think fairness means that you give equal time to every point of view no matter how marginal. You weigh the sides, you do some truth-testing, you apply judgment to them.

quotes.message: Fairness does not require the redistribution of wealth; it requires the creation of wealth, geared to an economy that can provide employment for everyone able and willing to work.

quotes.message: Fairness is man's ability to rise above his prejudices.

quotes.message: Art is a way of showing greater fairness to things than is customary.

quotes.message: Fairness dictates that the highest income people should pay the greatest share of taxes, and they do.

quotes.message: Simple fairness dictates that government must not raise taxes on families struggling to pay their bills.
quotes.name: Ronald Reagan

quotes.message: Fairness is actually not having presumptive negativity written about you and always assuming the worst about you.

quotes.message: Someone who values fairness and expects or, even better, wants to do his share in the home. These men exist and, trust me, over time, nothing is sexier.

quotes.message: Fairness means not to use fraud and trickery in the exchange of commodities and services and the exchange of feelings...Exploitation and manipulation produce boredom and triviality; they cripple man, and all factors that make man into a psychic cripple turn him also into a sadist or a destroyer.
quotes.name: Erich Fromm

quotes.message: Principles focusing on equality and fairness, those are principles that we can't let go of.
quotes.name: Niki Ashton

quotes.message: Justice as fairness provides what we want.

quotes.message: Today is the tomorrow we worried about yesterday.

quotes.message: At some stages of your life you will deal with things and at others you are overwhelmed with misery and anxiety.

quotes.message: In other people's company I felt I was dull, gloomy, unwelcome, at once bored and boring.

quotes.message: My anxiety level of my own work and what I'm doing and focusing on my art and all of that stuff? That's fundamental.

quotes.message: Anxiety is a deep conscious breath away from dissolving.

quotes.message: Even though loneliness affects so many of us, it has gotten scant research attention compared to related conditions like depression or anxiety.

quotes.message: He who fears he will suffer, already suffers from his fear.

quotes.message: Anxiety is the fear that one of a pair of opposites might cancel the other. Forever.
quotes.name: Alan Watts

quotes.message: It's better to have an ENEMY who honestly says they hate you than to have a FRIEND who's putting you down secretly

quotes.message: Fake people are like fools gold, it can be found everywhere yet it's worth nothing.

quotes.message: I hate fake people. You know what I'm talking about. Mannequins.

quotes.message: People wears a mask of lie so they look attractive, so be careful.

quotes.message: Everyone have two faces, but mine are twins.

quotes.message: Sometimes its not the person who change, it's the mask that falls off.

quotes.message: Fake friends are like plastic, if you're finished using it, you can trash it.

quotes.message: Don't be fooled by their mask.Fake people eventually show their true colors. Just wait until their mask needs cleaning.

quotes.message: Fake friends are like autumn leaves, they're scattered everywhere.
quotes.name: Author Unknown

quotes.message: It's funny how; The one person you'd take a bullet for tends to always be the one behind the gun.
quotes.name: Author Unknown

quotes.message: Sometimes it's a good thing to have fake people in this world. It helps you find out who your real friends are.

quotes.message: I hate two faced people. It's so hard to decide which face to slap first.
quotes.name: Author Unknown

quotes.message: Cannot trust anyone these days.
quotes.name: Author Unknown

quotes.message: The same person that speaks highly of you will be the same person that downs you. Be careful who you call friends.

quotes.message: Sometimes you have to distance yourself from all the folks that only calls when they need something

quotes.message: The only thing you get from being fake is losing your real friends and gaining more fake people in your circle
quotes.name: Author Unknown

quotes.message: Fake people have a hard time attaching themselves to people who have good self-esteem.

quotes.message: Fake people hate honesty. It's the lies that keep them feeling good about themselves and their lives.

quotes.message: Fake people will hang around as long as you let them. So, don't.

quotes.message: Why be fake? In the end, the truth comes out and when that happens, you're standing alone

quotes.message: Always sleep with one eye open. Never take anything for granted. Your best friends might just be your enemies.

quotes.message: Faking your own death is illegal, yet faking your own life is celebrated.

quotes.message: In the beginning, some people try to appear that everything about them is in black and white, until later their true colors come out.

quotes.message: Fake people are like soap bubbles, they pop out when the sun shines brightly.

quotes.message: Fake people talk about other people being fake. Real people worry about their business, and no one else's.

quotes.message: Nice words and nice appearance doesn't conclude that someone is nice, i believe that the nicer you look, the more deceptive you appear.

quotes.message: Time passes and you begin to see, people for who they really are and not who they pretend to be.

quotes.message: What's the whole point of being pretty on the outside when you're so ugly on the inside?

quotes.message: I love fake people provided they are mannequins.

quotes.message: Fake people are real counterfeits.

quotes.message: All women are dishonest. If they weren't, the world would be divided into two classes of people: old maids and bachelors.
quotes.name: Helen Broderick

quotes.message: These girls in love never realize they should be honestly dishonest instead of being dishonestly honest.
quotes.name: Clifton Webb

quotes.message: A fair face, a foul heart.
quotes.name: German Proverb

quotes.message: A fair skin often covers a crooked mind.
quotes.name: Danish Proverb

quotes.message: He who caresses thee more than the occasion justifies has either deceived thee or intends it.
quotes.name: French Proverb

quotes.message: The laughter, the tears, and the song of a woman are equally deceptive.
quotes.name: Roman Proverbs

quotes.message: For the most part, fraud, in the end, secures for its companions' repentance and shame.
quotes.name: C. Simmons

quotes.message: All frauds, like the wall, daubed with untempered mortar, with which men things to buttress up an edifice, always tend to the decay of what they are devised to support.
quotes.name: Whately

quotes.message: The first and worst of all frauds is to cheat oneself.
quotes.name: Bailey

quotes.message: The more gross the fraud, the more glibly will it go down, and the more greedily be swallowed since folly will always find faith where impostors will find impudence.
quotes.name: Cotton

quotes.message: It is time to fear when tyrants seem to kiss.
quotes.name: Shakespeare

quotes.message: Our double-dealing generally comes down upon ourselves—To speak or act a lie is alike contemptible in the sight of God and man.
quotes.name: Everton

quotes.message: Deceivers are the most dangerous members of society.—They trifle with the best affections of our nature, and violate the most sacred obligations.
quotes.name: Crabbe

quotes.message: And if, to be sure, sometimes you need to conceal a fact with words, do it in such a way that it does not become known, or if it does become known, that you have a ready and quick defense.
quotes.name: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.message: An open curse may prove a curse, . But a pretended friend is worse.
quotes.name: John Gay

quotes.message: Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: I sit on a man's back, choking him and making him carry me, and yet assure myself and others that I am very sorry for him and wish to ease his lot by all possible means—except by getting off his back.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: A friend to all is not a friend to anyone.
quotes.name: Mike Skinner

quotes.message: What's the whole point of being pretty on the outside when you're so ugly on the inside?
quotes.name: Jess C. Scott

quotes.message: A person's character is shown through their actions in life NOT where they sit on Sunday.
quotes.name: Navonne Johns

quotes.message: People wear a mask of lie so they look attractive, so be careful.
quotes.name: Muhammad Saqib

quotes.message: In the beginning, some people try to appear that everything about them is 'in black and white,' until later their true colors come out.
quotes.name: Anthony Liccione

quotes.message: Being too nice is a crime today. Fake friends are everywhere around you. they will use you and when you are of no use, throw you away like a wrapper.
quotes.name: Shizra

quotes.message: Act like you trust people, but don't.
quotes.name: Mayank Chawla

quotes.message: You don't lose friends because real friends can never be lost. You lose people masquerading as friends, and you’re better for it.

quotes.message: What greater wound is there than a false friend?

quotes.message: Be very careful of who you share your problem with, remember that not every friend that smiles at you is your best friend.
quotes.name: Kemmy Nola

quotes.message: This one step-choosing a goal and sticking to it-changes everything.
quotes.name: Scott Reed

quotes.message: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: All who have accomplished great things have had a great aim, have fixed their gaze on a goal which was high, one which sometimes seemed impossible.
quotes.name: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.message: The greater danger for most of us isn't that our aim is too high and miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.
quotes.name: Michelangelo

quotes.message: Most 'impossible' goals can be met simply by breaking them down into bite size chunks, writing them down, believing them, and then going full speed ahead as if they were routine.
quotes.name: Don Lancaster

quotes.message: Your goal should be just out of reach, but not out of sight.
quotes.name: Denis Waitley and Remi Witt

quotes.message: In all things that you do, consider the end.
quotes.name: Solon

quotes.message: Aim at the sun, and you may not reach it; but your arrow will fly far higher than if aimed at an object on a level with yourself.
quotes.name: J. Howes

quotes.message: Who aims at excellence will be above mediocrity; who aims at mediocrity will be far short of it.
quotes.name: Burmese Saying

quotes.message: Write it down. Written goals have a way of transforming wishes into wants; cant's into cans; dreams into plans; and plans into reality.
quotes.name: Michael Korda

quotes.message: Any man who selects a goal in life which can be fully achieved has already defined his own limitations.
quotes.name: Nido Qubein

quotes.message: The most important key to achieving great success is to decide upon your goal and launch, get started, take action, move.
quotes.name: Robert Collier

quotes.message: See the things you want as already yours. Think of them as yours, as belonging to you, as already in your possession.
quotes.name: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.message: Aim for the highest.
quotes.name: W. Clement Stone

quotes.message: Life takes on meaning when you become motivated, set goals and charge after them in an unstoppable manner.
quotes.name: Les Brown

quotes.message: Many people fail in life, not for lack of ability or brains or even courage but simply because they have never organized their energies around a goal.
quotes.name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.message: Our plans miscarry because they have no aim. When a man does not know what harbor he is making for, no wind is the right wind.
quotes.name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.message: The secret to productive goal setting is in establishing clearly defined goals, writing them down and then focusing on them several times a day with words, pictures and emotions as if we've already achieved them.
quotes.name: Geoffry Abert

quotes.message: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
quotes.name: C. S. Lewis

quotes.message: If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost; that is where they should be. Now put the foundations under them.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: If you aim at nothing, you'll hit it every time.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: Setting a goal is not the main thing. It is deciding how you will go about achieving it and staying with that plan.
quotes.name: Tom Landry

quotes.message: The important thing in life is to have a great aim, and the determination to attain it.
quotes.name: Goethe

quotes.message: Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.
quotes.name: Stephen A. Brennan

quotes.message: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy and inspires your hopes.
quotes.name: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.message: All successful people have a goal. No one can get anywhere unless he knows where he wants to go and what he wants to be or do.
quotes.name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.message: Man, with no objective, will soon possess nothing. Having an objective, even low, is better than having none.
quotes.name: Carlisle

quotes.message: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.name: Epictetus

quotes.message: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
quotes.name: Bo Jackson

quotes.message: You'll fail at a 100% of the goals you don't set.
quotes.name: Mark Victor Hansen

quotes.message: The most important key to achieving great success is to decide upon your goal and launch, get started, take action, move.
quotes.name: Brian Tracy

quotes.message: Big goals get big results. No goals get no results or somebody else's results.
quotes.name: Mark Victor Hansen

quotes.message: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
quotes.name: Anthony Robbins

quotes.message: People with goals succeed because they know where they are going. It's as simple as that.
quotes.name: Earl Nightingale

quotes.message: Without goals, and plans to reach them, you are like a ship that has set sail with no destination.
quotes.name: Fitzhugh Dodson

quotes.message: The goal you set must be challenging. At the same time, it should be realistic and attainable, not impossible to reach. It should be challenging enough to make you stretch, but not so far that you break.
quotes.name: Rick Hansen

quotes.message: The establishment of a clear,central purpose or goal in life is the starting point of all success.
quotes.name: Brian Tracy

quotes.message: Setting goals for your game is an art. The trick is in setting them at the right level neither too low nor too high.
quotes.name: Greg Norman

quotes.message: Goal Setting: I Set Long Term Goals II Set Short Term Goals III Set Objectives IV Prioritize the Objectives V Define and Detail VI Do It VII Evaluate
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: Set your goals high enough to inspire you and low enough to encourage you.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Define your business goals clearly so that others can see them as you do.
quotes.name: George F. Burns

quotes.message: Please don't nag yourself with thoughts of failure. Do not set goals far beyond your capacity to achieve. Simply do what you can do, in the best way you know, and the Lord will accept of your effort.
quotes.name: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.message: The major reason for setting a goal is for what it makes of you to accomplish it.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: In the long run, men hit only what they aim at. Therefore, though they should fail immediately, they had better aim at something high.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Not having a goal is more to be feared than not reaching a goal.
quotes.name: Robert Schuller

quotes.message: You have to set the goals that are almost out of reach. If you set a goal that is attainable without much work or thought, you are stuck with something below your true talent and potential.
quotes.name: Steve Garvey

quotes.message: Set goals that don't feel all that easy, that challenge you, stimulate you, and give you a chance to stretch and push yourself. That is where the power of growth lies.
quotes.name: Nathaniel Branden

quotes.message: The victory of success is half won when one gains the habit of setting goals and achieving them. Even the most tedious chore will become endurable as you parade through each day convinced that each task, no matter how menial or boring, brings you closer to achieving your dreams.
quotes.name: Og Mandino

quotes.message: Racism springs from ignorance.
quotes.name: Mario Balotelli

quotes.message: You don't fight racism with racism, the best way to fight racism is with solidarity.
quotes.name: Bobby Seale

quotes.message: No human race is superior; no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong.
quotes.name: Elie Wiesel

quotes.message: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.message: Do you know what we call opinion in the absence of evidence? We call it prejudice.
quotes.name: Michael Crichton

quotes.message: To like an individual because he's black is just as insulting as to dislike him because he isn't white.
quotes.name: E. E. Cummings

quotes.message: To live anywhere in the world today and be against equality because of race or color is like living in Alaska and being against snow.
quotes.name: William Faulkner

quotes.message: Hating people because of their color is wrong. And it doesn't matter which color does the hating. It's just plain wrong.
quotes.name: Muhammad Ali

quotes.message: Prejudice is the child of ignorance.
quotes.name: William Hazlitt

quotes.message: If a white man falls off a chair drunk, it's just a drunk. If a Negro does, it's the whole damn Negro race.
quotes.name: Bill Cosby

quotes.message: Racism, in the first place, is a weapon used by the wealthy to increase the profits they bring in by paying Black workers less for their work
quotes.name: Angela Davis

quotes.message: Racism is an ism to which everyone in the world today is exposed; for or against, we must take sides. And the history of the future will differ according to the decision which we make.
quotes.name: Ruth Benedict

quotes.message: Whites must be made to realize that they are only human, not superior. Same with blacks. They must be made to realize that they are also human, not inferior.
quotes.name: Steve Biko

quotes.message: The roots of racism lie deep in man's nature, wounded and bruised by original sin.
quotes.name: Sargent Shriver

quotes.message: One of the worst things about racism is what it does to young people.
quotes.name: Alvin Ailey

quotes.message: Any concept of one person being superior to another can lead to racism.
quotes.name: Walter Lang

quotes.message: It demands great spiritual resilience not to hate the hater whose foot is on your neck, and an even greater miracle of perception and charity not to teach your child to hate.
quotes.name: James Arthur Baldwin

quotes.message: Racism, because it favors color over talent, is bad for business.
quotes.name: Steven Pinker

quotes.message: Racism is a refuge for the ignorant. It seeks to divide and to destroy. It is the enemy of freedom, and deserves to be met head-on and stamped out.
quotes.name: Pierre Berton

quotes.message: Racism is beyond common sense and has no place in our society.
quotes.name: Steven Patrick Morrissey

quotes.message: People know about the Klan and the overt racism, but the killing of one's soul little by little, day after day, is a lot worse than someone coming in your house and lynching you.
quotes.name: Samuel L. Jackson

quotes.message: I was raised to believe that excellence is the best deterrent to racism or sexism. And that's how I operate my life.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: The color of the skin is in no way connected with strength of the mind or intellectual powers.
quotes.name: Benjamin Banneker

quotes.message: Racism cannot be cured solely by attacking some of the results it produces, like discrimination in housing or in education.
quotes.name: Sargent Shriver

quotes.message: Racism is ridiculous no matter where it's coming from.
quotes.name: Alan Ball

quotes.message: The minute you understand racism, you're responsible for being racist. It's like eating from the tree of knowledge.
quotes.name: Lynda Barry

quotes.message: In order to get beyond racism, we must first take account of race. There is no other way. And in order to treat some persons equally, we must treat them differently.
quotes.name: Harry A. Blackmun

quotes.message: The white man's happiness cannot be purchased by the black man's misery.
quotes.name: Frederick Douglass

quotes.message: A group of white South Africans recently killed a black lawyer because he was black. That was wrong. They should have killed him because he was a lawyer.
quotes.name: A. Whitney Brown

quotes.message: When people like me, they tell me it is in spite of my colour. When they dislike me, they point out that it is not because of my colour.
quotes.name: Frantz Fanon

quotes.message: Racism built me into a person that was set up to be self-destructive.
quotes.name: Jayson Blair

quotes.message: Lukewarm acceptance is more bewildering than outright rejection.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: A racially integrated community is a chronological term timed from the entrance of the first black family to the exit of the last white family.
quotes.name: Saul Alinsky

quotes.message: Let us all hope that the dark clouds of racial prejudice will soon pass away, and that in some not too distant tomorrow the radiant stars of love and brotherhood will shine over our great nation with all their scintillating beauty.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: At the heart of racism is the religious assertion that God made a creative mistake when He brought some people into being
quotes.name: Friedrich Otto Hertz

quotes.message: In this country American means white. Everybody else has to hyphenate.
quotes.name: Toni Morrison

quotes.message: You face racism in small and large ways.
quotes.name: Jayson Blair

quotes.message: Racism is not dead. Definitely, there are these biases.
quotes.name: John McWhorter

quotes.message: Racism isn't born, folks, it's taught. I have a two-year-old son. You know what he hates? Naps! End of list.
quotes.name: Denis Leary

quotes.message: The denial of racism is a form of racism itself.
quotes.name: Tim Wise

quotes.message: Racism, unfortunately, is part of the fabric of America's society.
quotes.name: David Scott

quotes.message: Racial superiority is a mere pigment of the imagination.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Discrimination is a disease.
quotes.name: Roger Staubach

quotes.message: Judgments prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances.
quotes.name: Wayne W. Dyer

quotes.message: It is never too late to give up our prejudices.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
quotes.name: Ralph W. Sockman

quotes.message: Our thoughts are unseen hands shaping the people we meet. Whatever we truly think them to be, that's what they'll become for us.
quotes.name: Richard Cowper

quotes.message: There is nothing like a newborn baby to renew your spirit and to buttress your resolve to make the world a better place.
quotes.name: Virginia Kelley

quotes.message: A baby is born with a need to be loved – and never outgrows it.
quotes.name: Frank A. Clark

quotes.message: For having a baby's sweet face so close to your own, for so long a time as it takes to nurse 'em, is a great tonic for a sad soul.
quotes.name: Erica Eisdorfer

quotes.message: Having a baby is like falling in love again, both with your husband and your child.
quotes.name: Tina Brown

quotes.message: Babies are living dolls with dancing smiles that come from the stars to still our hearts.
quotes.name: Debasish Mridha

quotes.message: A new baby is like the beginning of all things wonder, hope, a dream of possibilities.
quotes.name: Eda J. Le Shan

quotes.message: Those eyes so ecstatic with the gleam of new life, the wide laugh that no doubt uses up so much of the breath contained in those tiny lungs.
quotes.name: Saim Cheeda

quotes.message: There are words in the soul of a newborn baby, wanting and waiting to be written.
quotes.name: Toba Beta

quotes.message: Making the decision to have a child is momentous. It is to decide forever to have your heart go walking around outside your body.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Stone

quotes.message: Every child born into the world is a new thought of God, an ever-fresh and radiant possibility.
quotes.name: Kate Douglas Wiggin

quotes.message: Babies are the buds of imagination that are ready to bloom with lights of love and affection.
quotes.name: Debasish Mridha

quotes.message: Loving a baby is a circular business, a kind of feedback loop. The more you give the more you get and the more you get the more you feel like giving.
quotes.name: Penelope Leach

quotes.message: I think that I see something deeper, more infinite, more eternal than the ocean in the expression of the eyes of a little baby when it wakes in the morning and coos or laughs because it sees the sun shining on its cradle.
quotes.name: Vincent Van Gogh

quotes.message: With every newborn baby a little sun rises.
quotes.name: Irmgard Erath

quotes.message: Having a baby is a life-changer. It gives you a whole other perspective on why you wake up every day.
quotes.name: Taylor Hanson

quotes.message: Having a child is surely the most beautifully irrational act that two people in love can commit.
quotes.name: Bill Cosby

quotes.message: Each time a new baby is born there is a possibility of reprieve. Each child is a new being, a potential prophet, a new spiritual prince, a new spark of light precipitated into the outer darkness.
quotes.name: R. D. Laing

quotes.message: A babe in the house is a well-spring of pleasure, a messenger of peace and love, a resting place for innocence on earth, a link between angels and men.
quotes.name: Martin Farquhar Tupper

quotes.message: If your baby is 'beautiful and perfect, never cries or fusses, sleeps on schedule and burps on demand, an angel all the time,' you're the grandma.
quotes.name: Theresa Bloomingdale

quotes.message: Just like a plant needs light and space to grow, a child needs love and freedom to unfold.
quotes.name: Sigrid Leo

quotes.message: A baby is a blank check made payable to the human race.
quotes.name: Barbara Christine Seifert

quotes.message: Babies are bits of stardust, blown from the hand of God.
quotes.name: Barretto

quotes.message: When babies look beyond you and giggle maybe they're seeing Angels.
quotes.name: Eileen Elias Freeman

quotes.message: Babies are like little suns that, in a magical way, bring warmth, happiness and light into our lives.
quotes.name: Kartini Diapari-Oengider

quotes.message: Ah, babies! They're more than just adorable little creatures on whom you can blame your farts.
quotes.name: Tina Fey

quotes.message: Life doesn't get more real than having a newborn at home.
quotes.name: Eric Church

quotes.message: Words can not express the joy of new life.
quotes.name: Hermann Hesse

quotes.message: A father is always making his baby into a little woman. And when she is a woman he turns her back again.
quotes.name: Enid Bagnol

quotes.message: Every baby born into the world is a finer one than the last.
quotes.name: Charles Dickens

quotes.message: Babies are thinking and attracting before they are speaking. Even though you are only months old in your physical body, you are a very old and wise Creator, focused in that baby's body.
quotes.name: Abraham-Hicks

quotes.message: When the first baby laughed for the first time, the laugh broke into a thousand pieces and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies. And now when every new baby is born it's first laugh becomes a fairy.
quotes.name: James Matthew Barrie

quotes.message: We are grateful for this ne being, who is small in body, yet great in soul, who has come into our midst as a gift.
quotes.name: Ann Spring

quotes.message: When a child is born, so are grandmothers.
quotes.name: Judith Levy

quotes.message: The birth of every new baby is God's vote of confidence in the future of man.
quotes.name: Imogene Fey

quotes.message: The worst feature of a new baby is it's mother's singing.
quotes.name: Kin Hubbard

quotes.message: A baby is something you carry inside you for nine months, in your arms for three years, and in your heart till the day you die.
quotes.name: Mary Mason

quotes.message: Babies are such a nice way to start people.
quotes.name: Don Herrold

quotes.message: A little child born yesterday. A thing on mother's milk and kisses fed.
quotes.name: Oercy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.message: To give life to another being, what a gift! When he finally was placed into my arms, I looked into his precious eyes and felt an overwhelming, unconditional love. I never felt so complete and empowered in my life.
quotes.name: Giselle Bundchen

quotes.message: The only creatures that are evolved enough to convey pure love are dogs and infants.
quotes.name: Johnny Depp

quotes.message: With each spring comes new life, energy, and green growth.
quotes.name: Jason F. Wright

quotes.message: Why does a mother love her newborn? Because the baby is hers? Even more. Because the baby is her. Her blood, her flesh. Her sinew and spine. Her hope. Her legacy.
quotes.name: Max Lucado

quotes.message: And the rain was insuperably Immortal; and so was my new born baby daughter;disseminating only the beats of love; love and Immortally princely love; every time her godly heart throbbed in her tiny chest.
quotes.name: Nikhil Parekh

quotes.message: Naming newborn children is considered a principle divine rule.
quotes.name: Abu Mohammad Ordoni

quotes.message: As newborn babes desire the sincere milk of the world, that ye may grow thereby: if so be ye have tasted that the Lord is gracious.
quotes.name: 1 Peter 2:2

quotes.message: A baby is God's opinion that life should go on. Never will a time come when the most marvelous recent invention is as marvelous as a newborn baby.
quotes.name: Carl Sandburg

quotes.message: Baby love, baby mild. Welcome, welcome brand new child.
quotes.name: Linda Robertson

quotes.message: For the newborn and wise, everything begins small.
quotes.name: Suzy Kassem

quotes.message: It's difficult when you have a new baby but, at the same time, a nice distraction.
quotes.name: Jack Wilshere

quotes.message: Anyone who's looked into a newborn's innocent eyes should realize how incredible it is to be blessed with a new life.
quotes.name: John Kennedy

quotes.message: Parent should never forget the great excitement they felt for the birth of a new born into the world.
quotes.name: Lila Gifty Akita

quotes.message: No use thinking of the past for its gone, don't think of the future because it has to come, think of the present because thats where you are.
quotes.name: Kazi Shams

quotes.message: Yesterday's the past, tomorrow's the future, but today is a gift. That's why it's called the present.
quotes.name: Bil Keane

quotes.message: Time is what we want most, but... what we use worst.
quotes.name: William Penn

quotes.message: Time is a cruel thief to rob us of our former selves. We lose as much to life as we do to death.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Forsythe Hailey

quotes.message: If time flies when you're having fun, it hits the afterburners when you don't think you're having enough.
quotes.name: Jef Mallett

quotes.message: If we take care of the moments, the years will take care of themselves.
quotes.name: Maria Edgeworth

quotes.message: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
quotes.name: Theophrastus

quotes.message: Time is the longest distance between two places.
quotes.name: Tennessee Williams

quotes.message: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to.
quotes.name: Lao Tzu

quotes.message: Know the true value of time; snatch, seize, and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness, no laziness, no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
quotes.name: Philip Stanhope

quotes.message: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.
quotes.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.message: The timeless in you is aware of life's timelessness. And knows that yesterday is but today's memory and tomorrow is today's dream.
quotes.name: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.message: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.
quotes.name: C.S. Lewis

quotes.message: Suspect each moment, for it is a thief, tiptoeing away with more than it brings.
quotes.name: John Updike

quotes.message: The common man is not concerned about the passage of time, the man of talent is driven by it.
quotes.name: Shoppenhauer

quotes.message: Old Time, that greatest and longest established spinner of all!.... his factory is a secret place, his work is noiseless, and his hands are mutes.
quotes.name: Charles Dickens

quotes.message: Time = life; therefore, waste your time and waste of your life, or master your time and master your life.
quotes.name: Alan Lakein

quotes.message: Don't be fooled by the calendar. There are only as many days in the year as you make use of. One man gets only a week's value out of a year while another man gets a full year's value out of a week.
quotes.name: Charles Richards

quotes.message: We all have our time machines. Some take us back, they're called memories. Some take us forward, they're called dreams.
quotes.name: Jeremy Irons

quotes.message: Time ripens all things; with Time all things are revealed; Time is the father of truth.
quotes.name: Francois Rabelais

quotes.message: Men talk of killing time, while time quietly kills them.
quotes.name: Dion Boucicault

quotes.message: For disappearing acts, it's hard to beat what happens to the eight hours supposedly left after eight of sleep and eight of work.
quotes.name: Doug Larson

quotes.message: It's a strange thing, but when you are dreading something, and would give anything to slow down time, it has a disobliging habit of speeding up.
quotes.name: J.K. Rowling

quotes.message: Time is like the wind, it lifts the light and leaves the heavy.
quotes.name: Dominico Cieri Estrada

quotes.message: There is one kind of robber whom the law does not strike at, and who steals what is most precious to men: time.
quotes.name: Napoleon I

quotes.message: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
quotes.name: Carl Sandburg

quotes.message: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much can be done if we are always doing.
quotes.name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.message: A man who dares to waste one hour of life has not discovered the value of life.
quotes.name: Charles Darwin

quotes.message: Time is a brisk wind, for each hour it brings something new...
quotes.name: Paracelsus

quotes.message: The world was made, not in time, but simultaneously with time. There was no time before the world.
quotes.name: Augustine of Hippo

quotes.message: Time goes, you say? Ah no! Alas, time stays, we go.
quotes.name: Austin Dobson

quotes.message: There is more time than life.
quotes.name: Mexican Proverb

quotes.message: Time can bring you down, time can bend you knees. Times can break your heart, have you begging please…Beyond the door, there’s peace I’m sure. And I know there’ll be no more tears in heaven.
quotes.name: Eric Clapton

quotes.message: Time is neutral and does not change things. With courage and initiative, leaders change things.
quotes.name: Jesse Jackson

quotes.message: If you let slip time, like a neglected rose it withers on the stalk with languished head.
quotes.name: John Milton

quotes.message: The moment hung in time like a miner’s hat on an oaken peg in a saloon abandoned ninety years ago.
quotes.name: Loren D. Estleman

quotes.message: The passing years are like a mist sweeping up from the sea of time so that my memories acquire new aspects.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: She was forever saving time, like bits of string.
quotes.name: Helen Hudson

quotes.message: There is a rhythm inside a year of time, like a great mainspring that keeps it ticking from spring to summer to fall to winter.
quotes.name: Borden Deal

quotes.message: Time…a substance of some sort which existence burned up like a fire.
quotes.name: Susan Fromberg Schaeffer

quotes.message: Time fled past us like a startled bird.
quotes.name: James Crumley

quotes.message: If time seems to pass so quickly, this is because there are no landmarks. Like the moon when it is at its heights on the horizon.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: As the waves make toward the pebbled shore, so do our minutes hasten to their end.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: The day runs through me as water through a sieve.
quotes.name: Samuel Butler

quotes.message: We must use time as a tool, not as a crutch.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time.
quotes.name: Mason Cooley

quotes.message: Lost time is never found again.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
quotes.name: Thomas Hardy

quotes.message: Those who make the worst use of their time are the first to complain of its brevity.
quotes.name: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.message: Time is an illusion.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: Time takes it all, whether you want it to or not.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: Better three hours too soon, than one minute too late.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
quotes.name: Pericles

quotes.message: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.
quotes.name: Delmore Schwartz

quotes.message: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
quotes.name: Rodin

quotes.message: The key is in not spending time, but in investing it.
quotes.name: Stephen R. Covey

quotes.message: Time brings all things to pass.
quotes.name: Aeschylus

quotes.message: Who forces time is pushed back by time; who yields to time finds time on his side.
quotes.name: The Talmud

quotes.message: You can't make up for lost time. You can only do better in the future.
quotes.name: Ashley Ormon

quotes.message: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
quotes.name: Mother Teresa

quotes.message: I must govern the clock, not be governed by it.
quotes.name: Golda Meir

quotes.message: We must use time wisely and forever realize that the time is always ripe to do right.
quotes.name: Nelson Mandela

quotes.message: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
quotes.name: Andy Warhol

quotes.message: The time for action is now. It’s never too late to do something.
quotes.name: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.message: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
quotes.name: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.message: Whether it’s the best of times or the worst of times, it’s the only time we’ve got.
quotes.name: Art Buchwald

quotes.message: You may delay, but time will not.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: If you love life, don’t waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
quotes.name: Bruce Lee

quotes.message: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you’ll never get it done.
quotes.name: Bruce Lee

quotes.message: The present time has one advantage over every other – it is our own.
quotes.name: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.message: You can’t have a better tomorrow if you are thinking about yesterday all the time.
quotes.name: Charles F. Kettering

quotes.message: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: In such seconds of decision entire futures are made.
quotes.name: Dan Simmons

quotes.message: How did it get so late so soon? It’s night before it’s afternoon. December is here before it’s June. My goodness how the time has flewn.
quotes.name: Dr. Seuss

quotes.message: Time is free, but it’s priceless. You can’t own it, but you can use it. You can’t keep it, but you can spend it. Once you’ve lost it you can never get it back.
quotes.name: Harvey Mackay

quotes.message: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Most people spend more time and energy going around problems than in trying to solve them.
quotes.name: Henry Ford

quotes.message: Lost, yesterday, somewhere between Sunrise and Sunset, two golden hours, each set with sixty diamond minutes. No reward is offered, for they are gone forever.
quotes.name: Horace Mann

quotes.message: The future is uncertain but the end is always near.
quotes.name: Jim Morrison

quotes.message: Every second is of infinite value.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: The way we spend our time defines who we are.
quotes.name: Jonathan Estrin

quotes.message: Do we need more time? Or do we need to be more disciplined with the time we have?
quotes.name: Kerry Johnson

quotes.message: There’s only one thing more precious than our time and that’s who we spend it on.
quotes.name: Leo Christopher

quotes.message: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
quotes.name: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.message: Until you value yourself, you won’t value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it.
quotes.name: M. Scott Peck

quotes.message: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
quotes.name: Duke Ellington

quotes.message: I learned there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead, others come from behind. But I've bought a big bat. I'm all ready, you see. Now my troubles are going to have trouble with me.
quotes.name: Dr. Seuss

quotes.message: Life is at its best when everything has fallen out of place, and you decide that you're going to fight to get them right, not when everything is going your way and everyone is praising you.
quotes.name: Thisuri Wanniarachchi

quotes.message: We all want things to stay the same. Settle for living in misery because we are afraid of change, of things crumbling to ruins. Ruin is a gift. Ruin is the road to transformation.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.message: When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this: you haven't.
quotes.name: Thomas Edison

quotes.message: Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.
quotes.name: J.K. Rowling

quotes.message: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure that you seek.
quotes.name: Joseph Campbell

quotes.message: They tried to bury us, but they didn't know that we were seeds.
quotes.name: Mexican Proverb

quotes.message: A bend in the road is not the end of the road... unless you fail to make the turn.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: In the midst of winter, I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: The difference between stumbling blocks and stepping stones is how you use them.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.
quotes.name: Richard M. Nixon

quotes.message: I ask not for a lighter burden, but for broader shoulders.
quotes.name: Jewish Proverb

quotes.message: When things are bad, we take comfort in the thought that they could always get worse. And when they are, we find hope in the thought that things are so bad they have to get better.
quotes.name: Malcolm S Forbes

quotes.message: It always seems impossible until it's done.
quotes.name: Nelson Mandela

quotes.message: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
quotes.name: Richard Bach

quotes.message: Obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
quotes.name: Michael Jordan

quotes.message: This too shall pass.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
quotes.name: Henry Ford

quotes.message: Facing it, always facing it, that's the way to get through. Face it.
quotes.name: Joseph Conrad

quotes.message: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
quotes.name: Khalil Gibran

quotes.message: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: After all, tomorrow is another day!
quotes.name: Margaret Mitchell

quotes.message: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
quotes.name: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.message: There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
quotes.name: Bernard Williams

quotes.message: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
quotes.name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.message: When the going gets tough, the tough get going.
quotes.name: Joseph Kennedy

quotes.message: Through all the heartaches and the tears, through gloomy days and fruitless years; I do give thanks for now I know, these were the things that helped me grow.
quotes.name: David Lockett

quotes.message: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
quotes.name: Bernice Johnson Reagon

quotes.message: A hard beginning maketh a good ending.
quotes.name: John Heywood

quotes.message: Hard times arouse an instinctive desire for authenticity.
quotes.name: Coco Chanel

quotes.message: I can do ALL THINGS through Christ who strengthens me.
quotes.name: Philippians 4:13

quotes.message: If we could all just laugh at ourselves, in hard times or good times, it would be an incredible world.
quotes.name: Jena Malone

quotes.message: People need hard times and oppression to develop psychic muscles.
quotes.name: Emily Dickinson

quotes.message: I have no regrets in my life. I think that everything happens to you for a reason. The hard times that you go through build character, making you a much stronger person.
quotes.name: Rita Mero

quotes.message: Looking back, we see with great clarity, and what once appeared as difficulties now reveal themselves as blessings.
quotes.name: Dan Millman

quotes.message: Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.
quotes.name: Helen Keller

quotes.message: You're a winner. The tests of life are not meant to break you, but to make you.
quotes.name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.message: Look for the opportunities in the difficulties, not the difficulties in the opportunities.
quotes.name: Victor Fiorelli

quotes.message: Real difficulties can be overcome; it is only the imaginary ones that are unconquerable.
quotes.name: Theodore Newton Vail

quotes.message: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
quotes.name: Bernice Johnson Reagon

quotes.message: Difficult times have helped me to understand better than before how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way, and that so many things that one goes worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
quotes.name: Karen Blixen

quotes.message: Every problem has a gift for you in its hands.
quotes.name: Richard Bach

quotes.message: Don't take it on yourself. Forget now. Live.
quotes.name: Arthur Miller

quotes.message: Every one of us gets through the tough times because somebody is there, standing in the gap to close it for us.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: Never spend more than 10 percent of your time on the problem, and always spend at least 90 percent of your time on the solution.
quotes.name: Anthony Robbins

quotes.message: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. Please remember that your difficulties do not define you. They simply strengthen your ability to overcome.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: Don't dwell on what went wrong. Instead, focus on what to do next. Spend your energies on moving forward toward finding the answer.
quotes.name: Denis Waitley

quotes.message: In gambling the many must lose in order that the few may win.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: The gambling interests like to point to the construction jobs, but those jobs go away.
quotes.name: John Warren Kindt

quotes.message: The subject of gambling is all encompassing. It combines man's natural play instinct with his desire to know about his fate and his future.
quotes.name: Franz Rosenthal

quotes.message: Victory is a fleeting thing in the gambling business. Today's winners are tomorrow's blinking toads, dumb beasts with no hope.
quotes.name: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.message: I figure you have the same chance of winning the lottery whether you play or not.
quotes.name: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.message: You bring in gambling into a major population base, and the more people you have going into a casino, the more people you have hooked on gambling.
quotes.name: John Warren Kindt

quotes.message: At the gambling table, there are no fathers and sons.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Gambling has held human beings in thrall for millennia. It has been engaged in everywhere, from the dregs of society to the most respectable circles.
quotes.name: Peter L Bernstein

quotes.message: If you must play, decide upon three things at the start: the rules of the game, the stakes, and the quitting time.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Gambling operates under the premise that greed can be satisfied by luck.
quotes.name: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.message: Gambling is not a vice, it is an expression of our humanness. We gamble. Some do it at the gaming table, some do not. You play, you win, you play, you lose. You play.
quotes.name: Jeanette Winterson

quotes.message: Gambling is the great leveller. All men are equal at cards.
quotes.name: Nikolai Gogol

quotes.message: At gambling, the deadly sin is to mistake bad play for bad luck.
quotes.name: Ian Fleming

quotes.message: The gambling supply house catalog is distinctly not the safest place to learn about cheating devices, beware of catalog men.
quotes.name: John Scarne

quotes.message: Gambling makes boys selfish and cruel as well as men.
quotes.name: Thomas Hughes

quotes.message: Gambling is entertainment. People go to casinos to be entertained.
quotes.name: Eric Schneiderman

quotes.message: The gambling known as business looks with austere disfavor upon the business known as gambling.
quotes.name: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.message: Gambling is not as destructive as war or as boring as pornography. It is not as immoral as business or as suicidal as watching television. And the percentages are better than religion.
quotes.name: Mario Puzo

quotes.message: Gambling can turn into a dangerous two-way street when you least expect it. Weird things happen suddenly, and your life can go all to pieces.
quotes.name: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.message: A Gentleman is a man who will pay his gambling debts even when he knows he has been cheated.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: Gambling with cards or dice or stocks is all one thing. It's getting money without giving an equivalent for it.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.message: It's hard to walk away from a winning streak, even harder to leave the table when you're on a losing one.
quotes.name: Cara Bertoia

quotes.message: I want people to understand, gambling is not a bad thing if you do it within the framework of what it's meant to be, which is fun and entertaining.
quotes.name: Michael Jordan

quotes.message: Gambling is an act of faith of gamblers. Prophecy is an act of faith of the saints.
quotes.name: Toba Beta

quotes.message: Gambling is a disease of barbarians superficially civilized.
quotes.name: Dean Inge

quotes.message: All gambling is the telling of a fortune, but of a monstrously depleted fortune, empty of everything save one numerical circumstance, shorn of all such richness as a voyage across the water, a fair man that loves you, a dark woman that means you harm.
quotes.name: Rebecca West

quotes.message: Time spent in a casino is time given to death, a foretaste of the hour when one's flesh will be diverted to the purposes of the worm and not of the will.
quotes.name: Rebecca West

quotes.message: Gambling is a principle inherent in human nature.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: By gaming we lose both our time and treasure: two things most precious to the life of man.
quotes.name: Owen Feltham

quotes.message: Gambling: The sure way of getting nothing for something.
quotes.name: Wilson Mizner

quotes.message: Some psychiatrists claim gambling is masochistic, that gamblers want to lose to punish themselves. Sure some do. Some People like to jump off the Empire State Building. But millions go up to look at the view.
quotes.name: Mario Puzo

quotes.message: A gambler is someone who plays slot machines. I prefer to own slot machines.
quotes.name: Donald Trump

quotes.message: It's the risk I like about owning a casino. Some days you win, other days you win more.
quotes.name: Paul Lyons

quotes.message: No use gambling if you can't lose your head once in a while.
quotes.name: Larry Merchant

quotes.message: So the gambler, lest he should lose, does not stop losing.
quotes.name: Ovid

quotes.message: He was so sure he would lose that he had not played everything— as if to prolong the sensation of losing.
quotes.name: Andre Malraux

quotes.message: They gambled with me for my heart with all kinds of games. They defeated me and took it away.
quotes.name: As-Sanawbari

quotes.message: The solemn resolutions, which are nevertheless broken, never to do it again, the stupefying pleasure and the bad conscience which tells the subject he is ruining himself.
quotes.name: Sigmund Freud

quotes.message: Bad beats haunt you like bad dreams.
quotes.name: Alvin Alvarez

quotes.message: Show me a gambler and I'll show you a loser.
quotes.name: Mario Puzo

quotes.message: To gamble is to risk, to approach 'the ruin factor.' When I was poor the ruin factor was not important. Hell, I was ruined anyway.
quotes.name: Mario Puzo

quotes.message: I play in order to lose. That's what gets my juice going. If I only bet on the games I know, I could at least break even.
quotes.name: Axel Freed

quotes.message: The games became burning lights on the floor of my withdrawal, and later, while I slept, there were poker chips falling through my dreams.
quotes.name: Jim Lewis

quotes.message: My only worry about my husband's gambling is that he may lose.
quotes.name: Spanish Proverb

quotes.message: It is possible that a wise and good man may be prevailed on to gamble; but it is impossible that a professed gamester should be a wise and good man.
quotes.name: Lavater

quotes.message: Some play for gain; to pass time others play; both play the fool; who gets byplay is loser in the end.
quotes.name: Heath

quotes.message: Curst is the wretch enslaved to such a vice, who ventures life and soul upon the dice.
quotes.name: Horace

quotes.message: All gaming, since it implies a desire to profit at the expense of others, involves a breach of the tenth commandment.
quotes.name: Whately

quotes.message: Gambling houses are temples where the most sordid and turbulent passions contend; there no spectator can be indifferent. A card or a small square of ivory interests more than the loss of an empire, or the ruin of an unoffending group of infants and their nearest relatives.
quotes.name: Zimmermann

quotes.message: Out of adultery comes murder, out of gambling comes thieving.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: In Texas it's not a question of gambling; it's a question of what time are we gambling. I mean, I grew up shooting dice.
quotes.name: Jackie Burke

quotes.message: Life is a big gambling game. Some are born lucky and some are born unlucky.
quotes.name: Jack London

quotes.message: I have a notion that gamblers are as happy as most people, being always excited; women, wine, fame, the table, even ambition, sate now & then, but every turn of the card & cast of the dice keeps the gambler alive— besides one can game ten times longer than one can do anything else.
quotes.name: Lord Byron

quotes.message: There is no gambling like politics.
quotes.name: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.message: I have no brief for gambling, nay . The notion I express . That money earned 's the only way . To pay for happiness. . With cards and dice I do not hold; . By betting I've been bit: . Conclusion: to get honest gold . You've got to sweat for it.
quotes.name: Robert William Service

quotes.message: To build a new way . That may lead, towards . The same outcome . So I dare not . I am afraid, . From such ones . It seems everyone is that . I cannot risk and bear . Such gambling again.
quotes.name: Ehsan Sehgal

quotes.message: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Quit while you're ahead. All the best gamblers do.
quotes.name: Baltasar Gracian y Morales

quotes.message: The only sure thing about luck is that it will change.
quotes.name: Bret Harte

quotes.message: The roulette table pays nobody . except him that keeps it.. Nevertheless a passion for gaming is common, . though a passion . for keeping roulette tables is unknown.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: Luck, bad if not good, will always be with us. But it has a way of favoring the intelligent and showing its back to the stupid.
quotes.name: John Dewey

quotes.message: Remember this: The house doesn't beat the player. It just gives him the opportunity to beat himself.
quotes.name: Nicholas Dandolos

quotes.message: I would rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not.
quotes.name: Lucille Ball

quotes.message: Live in the present tense, facing the duty at hand without regret for the past or worry over the future.
quotes.name: William De Witt Hyde

quotes.message: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
quotes.name: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quotes.message: If only. Those must be the two saddest words in the world.
quotes.name: Mercedes Lackey

quotes.message: Some choices we live not only once but a thousand times over, remembering them for the rest of our lives.
quotes.name: Richard Bach

quotes.message: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
quotes.name: John Barrymore

quotes.message: When one door closes, another opens; but we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we do not see the one which has opened for us.
quotes.name: Alexander Graham Bell

quotes.message: Regret for time wasted can become a power for good in the time that remains, if we will only stop the waste and the idle, useless regretting.
quotes.name: Arthur Brisbane

quotes.message: Remorse is virtue's root; its fair increase are fruits of innocence and blessedness.
quotes.name: William Cullen Bryant

quotes.message: Remorse. Never yield to remorse, but at once tell yourself: remorse would simply mean adding to the first act of stupidity a second.
quotes.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.message: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.
quotes.name: Steve Maraboli

quotes.message: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience.
quotes.name: Victoria Holt

quotes.message: I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.
quotes.name: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.message: We must all suffer from one of two pains: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret. The difference is discipline weighs ounces while regret weighs tons.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: Many of us crucify ourselves between two thieves - regret for the past and fear of the future.
quotes.name: Fulton Oursler

quotes.message: I have no regrets in my life. I think that everything happens to you for a reason. The hard times that you go through build character, making you a much stronger person.
quotes.name: Rita Mero

quotes.message: I would much rather have regrets about not doing what people said, than regretting not doing what my heart led me to and wondering what life had been like if I'd just been myself.
quotes.name: Brittany Ren_e

quotes.message: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
quotes.name: Sydney Smith

quotes.message: Forget regret, or life is yours to miss.
quotes.name: Jonathan Larson

quotes.message: Regret is ... an unavoidable result of any loss, for in loss we lose the tomorrow that we needed to make right our yesterday or today.
quotes.name: Gerald Lawson Sittser

quotes.message: Often regret is very false and displaced, and imagines the past to be totally other than it was.
quotes.name: John O'Donohue

quotes.message: Remorse is the poison of life.
quotes.name: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.message: In history as in human life, regret does not bring back a lost moment and a thousand years will not recover something lost in a single hour.
quotes.name: Stefan Zweig

quotes.message: Is it really so difficult to tell a good action from a bad one? I think one usually knows right away or a moment afterward, in a horrid flash of regret.
quotes.name: Mary Mccarthy

quotes.message: The What-ifs and the should-have's will eat your brain.
quotes.name: John O' Callaghan

quotes.message: Don't let the past steal your present.
quotes.name: Terri Guillemets

quotes.message: Don't let yesterday use up too much of today.
quotes.name: Will Rogers

quotes.message: I think I don't regret a single 'excess' of my responsive youth--I only regret, in my chilled age, certain occasions and possibilities I didn't embrace.
quotes.name: Henry James

quotes.message: To feel today what one felt yesterday isn't to feel - it's to remember today what was felt yesterday, to be today's living corpse of what yesterday was lived and lost.
quotes.name: Fernando Pessoa

quotes.message: I do not regret the things I've done, but those I did not do.
quotes.name: Rory Cochrane

quotes.message: Life is short. Break the rules, forgive quickly, kiss slowly, love truly, laugh uncontrollably, and never regret anything that made you smile.
quotes.name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.message: Never regret anything that has happened in your life. It cannot be changed, undone, or forgotten. So take it as a lesson learned, and move on.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Never regret anything that makes you smile.
quotes.name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.message: Always do your best. Your best is going to change from moment to moment. Under any circumstances, simply do your best and you will avoid self-judgement, self-abuse and regret.
quotes.name: Miguel Angel Ruiz

quotes.message: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time.
quotes.name: Mason Cooley

quotes.message: I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations - one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it - you will regret both.
quotes.name: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.message: Regret for wasted time can become a power for good in the time that remains, if we will only stop the waste and the idle, useless regretting.
quotes.name: Arthur Brisbane

quotes.message: We all make mistakes, have struggles, and even regret things in our past. But you are not your mistakes, you are not your struggles, and you are here NOW with the power to shape your day and your future.
quotes.name: Steve Maraboli

quotes.message: I have no regrets. I wouldn't have lived my life the way I did if I was going to worry about what people were going to say.
quotes.name: Ingrid Bergman

quotes.message: He who has regrets cannot look at himself in the mirror.
quotes.name: Eric Cantona

quotes.message: Regrets are the natural property of grey hairs.
quotes.name: Charles Dickens

quotes.message: Regrets and recriminations only hurt your soul.
quotes.name: Armand Hammer

quotes.message: You can have immediate regrets, but if you look at stuff and say, 'Things happen for a reason', there's a fatalistic thing about it. Something will happen that will justify it in some way.
quotes.name: Martin Landau

quotes.message: Regrets are the tears of good deeds left undone
quotes.name: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

quotes.message: The regrets and resentments etched in a heart remain until they are cleansed away with love.
quotes.name: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

quotes.message: Be too busy to have time for regrets.
quotes.name: Angela Wright

quotes.message: Speak when you are angry--and you will make the best speech you'll ever regret.
quotes.name: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.message: You'll regret opening your mouth. You'll rarely regret keeping it shut.
quotes.name: Max Lucado

quotes.message: Jealousy, that dragon which slays love under the pretence of keeping it alive.
quotes.name: Havelock Ellis

quotes.message: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
quotes.name: Salvador Dal

quotes.message: You can only be jealous of someone who has something you think you ought to have yourself.
quotes.name: Margaret Atwood

quotes.message: What sort of love is permeated by jealousy? You are jealous because you are unaware that everything you need is inside you.
quotes.name: Peter Deunov

quotes.message: The jealous are troublesome to others, but a torment to themselves.
quotes.name: William Penn

quotes.message: I've spent most of my life walking under that hovering cloud, jealousy, whose acid raindrops blurred my vision and burned holes in my heart. Once I learned to use the umbrella of confidence, the skies cleared up for me and the sunshine called joy became my faithful companion.
quotes.name: Astrid Alauda

quotes.message: Jealousy is the tribute mediocrity pays to genius.
quotes.name: Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.message: To cure jealousy is to see it for what it is, a dissatisfaction with self
quotes.name: Joan Didion

quotes.message: Love sees sharply, hatred sees even more sharp, but Jealousy sees the sharpest for it is love and hate at the same time.
quotes.name: Arab Proverb

quotes.message: Never waste jealousy on a real man: it is the imaginary man that supplants us all in the long run.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: Jealousy is simply and clearly the fear that you do not have value. Jealousy scans for evidence to prove the point - that others will be preferred and rewarded more than you. There is only one alternative - self-value. If you cannot love yourself, you will not believe that you are loved. You will always think it's a mistake or luck. Take your eyes off others and turn the scanner within. Find the seeds of your jealousy, clear the old voices and experiences. Put all the energy into building your personal and emotional security. Then you will be the one others envy, and you can remember the pain and reach out to them.
quotes.name: Jennifer James

quotes.message: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart.
quotes.name: George Eliot
