quotes.message: If we judge others, it is because we are judging something in ourselves of which we are unaware.
quotes.name: John A. Sandford

quotes.message: In judging others, folks will work overtime for no pay.
quotes.name: Charles Edwin Carruthers

quotes.message: The more one judges, the less one loves.
quotes.name: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.message: When you meet a man, you judge him by his clothes; when you leave, you judge him by his heart.
quotes.name: Russian Proverb

quotes.message: In judging of others, a man laboreth in vain, often erreth and easily sinneth; but in judging and examining himself, he always laboreth fruitfully.
quotes.name: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.message: To judge a man by his weakest link or deed is like judging the power of the ocean by one wave.
quotes.name: Elvis Presley

quotes.message: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.message: A person that judges others will inevitably judge themselves harshly. It is only when one stops judging others that, that one can truly appreciate the beauty within.
quotes.name: Ando Oomae

quotes.message: None are more unjust in their judgments of others than those who have a high opinion of themselves.
quotes.name: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.message: If you find it necessary to judge someone by their past, don't be surprised when they find it necessary to put you there.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: When we come to judge others it is not by ourselves as we really are that we judge them, but by an image that we have formed of ourselves from which we have left out everything that offends our vanity or would discredit us in the eyes of the world.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: To judge a man means nothing more than to ask: What content does he give to the form of humanity? What concept should we have of humanity if he were its only representative?
quotes.name: Wilhelm Von Humboldt

quotes.message: I do not judge men by anything they can do. Their greatest deed is the impression they make on me.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Every man is entitled to be valued by his best moment.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Our natural egoism leads us to judge people by their relations to ourselves. We want them to be certain things to us, and for us that is what they are; because the rest of them is no good to us, we ignore it.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: By judging others, you make yourself easy to judge.
quotes.name: Ashly Lorenzana

quotes.message: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
quotes.name: Mother Teresa

quotes.message: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
quotes.name: The Bible

quotes.message: The least amount of judging we can do, the better off we are.
quotes.name: Michael J Fox

quotes.message: Don't pass judgement on others or you might be judged yourself.
quotes.name: Brian Cohen

quotes.message: Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance.
quotes.name: Jean de la Fontaine

quotes.message: Instead of judging people, we need to pray.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: I can usually judge a fellow by what he laughs at.
quotes.name: Wilson Mizner

quotes.message: If you judge, investigate.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: If you would judge, understand.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Judge not according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.
quotes.name: Bible

quotes.message: No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.
quotes.name: Napoleon Hill

quotes.message: Do not judge, and you will never be mistaken.
quotes.name: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quotes.message: Judge not others unless you're prepared to be judged!
quotes.name: Johnny Rotten

quotes.message: People are always judging you based on where you're from, where you went to school, how you look, how you talk. But at the end of the day, you're going to have to look into the mirror and accept who you are. It's all about being authentic.
quotes.name: Andre Carson

quotes.message: The most dangerous leap is the leap to conclusions.
quotes.name: Woodrow Kroll

quotes.message: Never judge someone's character based on the words of another.
quotes.name: Suzy Kassem

quotes.message: Your judgments about another person say more about your own character than the character of the person you are pointing a finger at.
quotes.name: Alaric Hutchinson

quotes.message: Judging others is easy because it distracts us from the responsibility of judging ourselves.
quotes.name: Charles F. Glassman

quotes.message: When we generalize and judge people quickly without taking ample time, we've chosen a shortcut. It's superficial of us, and a lack of wisdom.
quotes.name: Assegid W. Habtewold

quotes.message: Praising God distracts us from the awful business of judging others and losing ourselves.
quotes.name: Brian A. Pankratz

quotes.message: He who judges himself will always judge others.
quotes.name: Vironika Tugaleva

quotes.message: Judge not, that ye be not judged. For with judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
quotes.name: Matthew 7:1-2

quotes.message: Do you, my friend, pass judgement on others? You have no excuse at all, whoever you are. For when you judge others and then do the same things which they do, you condemn yourself.
quotes.name: Romans 2:1

quotes.message: If you spend time judging and criticizing people, you will not have time to heal from your pain or brokenness. You cannot love yourself when you judge or criticize others who are created in God's image and after His Likeness...in which you are also created.
quotes.name: Kemi Sogunle

quotes.message: Judgment separates us from the people we want to be close to incredibly quickly. Whether it’s our internal self-judgment that shuts down opportunity for connection or our judgment of others that makes it hard for loved ones to open up to us, judgment is cancer for authenticity in relationships.
quotes.name: Gina Senarighi

quotes.message: People make mistakes. When you judge them, you measure their weakness against your own strength. That’s not a fair measure. They have their strength, too. Their strength might be the weakest point in your life.
quotes.name: Nesta Jojoe Erskine

quotes.message: Only the shallow judge others, those with character know to judge themselves before they judge others.
quotes.name: Abhijit Naskar

quotes.message: We cannot judge either of the feelings or of the characters of men with perfect accuracy from their actions or their appearance in public; it is from their careless conversations, their half-finished sentences, that we may hope with the greatest probability of success to discover their real characters.
quotes.name: Maria Edgeworth

quotes.message: I know people can be judgmental and difficult. But if you shut yourself away from the world, you'll never see how beautiful it really is.
quotes.name: Imania Margria

quotes.message: Judging others is space-time wasted.
quotes.name: Rajesh

quotes.message: Judging the things you do not understand is like a game of gambling where setbacks are often than success.
quotes.name: Amit Kalantri

quotes.message: Let us not therefor judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumbling block or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.
quotes.name: Romans 14:12-13

quotes.message: Who judges others condemns himself.
quotes.name: Martin H. Manser

quotes.message: No man can justify censure or condemn another because indeed no man truly knows another.
quotes.name: Sir Thomas Browne

quotes.message: When it seems that God shows us the faults of others, keep on the safer side. It may be that thy judgment is false.
quotes.name: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.message: You will not become a saint through other people's sins.
quotes.name: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

quotes.message: The business of finding fault is very easy, and that of doing better very difficult.
quotes.name: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.message: The Lord knows those who are His. He will determine the saved and unsaved, and will never ask any man's opinion. So let's not give one.
quotes.name: Virgil Hurley

quotes.message: A desire to disgrace others never sprang from grace.
quotes.name: George Swinnock

quotes.message: Do not think of the faults of others but of what is good in them and faulty in yourself.
quotes.name: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.message: A man's judgment of another depends more on the judging and on his passions than on the one being judged and his conduct.
quotes.name: Paul Tournier

quotes.message: Judging others makes us blind, whereas love is illuminating.
quotes.name: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quotes.message: The only measure of judging a human being is through that person’s character, because character is not determined by race, religion, gender or social status.
quotes.name: Abhijit Naskar

quotes.message: We are all flawed and creatures of our times.
quotes.name: Carl Sagan

quotes.message: Never judge people based on their nationality, religion, race, gender, skin colour or look. Humans are all the same. They’re God’s loving children.
quotes.name: Lily Amis

quotes.message: A man's judged by what he is and not what he was.
quotes.name: Jack Caldwell

quotes.message: Go a little easy on the people around you. Try to reel in judging thoughts. Think before you speak.
quotes.name: John Manning

quotes.message: We can learn how to stop judging and begin to accept and receive people where they are. Instead of judging them, we must become like them to win them.
quotes.name: Sandra M. Michelle

quotes.message: Even the largest army is nothing without a good general.
quotes.name: Afghan

quotes.message: He that cannot obey, cannot command.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: He who rules must fully humor as much as he commands.
quotes.name: George Eliot

quotes.message: The good will of the governed will be starved if not fed by the good deeds of the governors.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: The higher the monkey climbs, the more he shows his tail.
quotes.name: John Wycliffe

quotes.message: The master of the people is their servant.
quotes.name: Yemeni

quotes.message: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.
quotes.name: John Quincy Adams

quotes.message: The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things.
quotes.name: Ronald Reagan

quotes.message: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.message: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.
quotes.name: John C. Maxwell

quotes.message: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself, or to get all the credit for doing it.
quotes.name: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.message: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd.
quotes.name: Max Lucado

quotes.message: Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.
quotes.name: Warren Bennis

quotes.message: A man can only lead when others accept him as their leader, and he has only as much authority as his subjects give to him. All of the brilliant ideas in the world cannot save your kingdom if no one will listen to them.
quotes.name: Brandon Sanderson

quotes.message: Leadership does not always wear the harness of compromise.
quotes.name: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.message: The task of leadership is not to put greatness into humanity, but to elicit it, for the greatness is already there.
quotes.name: John Buchan

quotes.message: A gentle hand may lead even an elephant by a hair.
quotes.name: Iranian

quotes.message: A great one must have a long heart.
quotes.name: Ethiopian

quotes.message: A ruler must sometimes humor as well as command.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Great chiefs prove their worthiness.
quotes.name: Seneca Proverb

quotes.message: If the townspeople are happy, look to the chief.
quotes.name: Liberian

quotes.message: If you can't serve, you can't rule.
quotes.name: Bulgarian

quotes.message: In the country of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
quotes.name: Desiderius Erasmus

quotes.message: When we think we lead, we are most led.
quotes.name: Lord Byron

quotes.message: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
quotes.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.message: Never give an order that can't be obeyed.
quotes.name: General Douglas MacArthur

quotes.message: Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.
quotes.name: George Patton

quotes.message: Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing.
quotes.name: Albert Schweiter

quotes.message: You do not lead by hitting people over the head. That's assault, not leadership.
quotes.name: Dwight Eisenhower

quotes.message: Anyone can hold the helm when the sea is calm.
quotes.name: Publilus Syrus

quotes.message: Be a yardstick of quality. Some people aren't used to an environment where excellence is expected.
quotes.name: Steve Jobs

quotes.message: The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.
quotes.name: Ray Kroc

quotes.message: Lead, follow, or get out of the way.
quotes.name: Thomas Pane

quotes.message: It's hard to lead a cavalry charge if you think you look funny on a horse.
quotes.name: Adlai Stevenson II

quotes.message: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: If you would convince a man that he does wrong, do right. But do not care to convince him. Men will believe what they see. Let them see.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.name: Harold McAlindon

quotes.message: The art of leadership is saying no, not yes. It is very easy to say yes.
quotes.name: Tony Blair

quotes.message: Part of the happiness of life consists not in fighting battles, but in avoiding them. A masterly retreat is in itself a victory.
quotes.name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.message: Leadership and learning are indispensable to one another.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Don't find fault, find a remedy.
quotes.name: Henry Ford

quotes.message: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage with others.
quotes.name: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.message: Learn to see things backwards, inside out, and upside down.
quotes.name: John Heider

quotes.message: Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
quotes.name: Peter Drucker

quotes.message: Good leadership consists of showing average people how to do the work of superior people.
quotes.name: John D. Rockefeller

quotes.message: Power isn’t control at all — power is strength, and giving that strength to others. A leader isn’t someone who forces others to make him stronger; a leader is someone willing to give his strength to others that they may have the strength to stand on their own.
quotes.name: Beth Revis

quotes.message: Leadership is simple: Add value to people everyday.
quotes.name: Mike Krzyzewski

quotes.message: Our recovery didn't happen by accident. It happened because we did what we were hired to do: to lead and manage by results.
quotes.name: Michael Bloomberg

quotes.message: The key to being a good leader is to focus on the mission and know how to implement a plan without getting lost in the swamp!
quotes.name: Donald J. Palmisano

quotes.message: Leadership starts with respecting others and paying attention to the needs of those around you. Respecting those who you lead, may lead, follow or just touch with your mind and eyes. You don't lead because you want to lead; you lead because they want to follow.
quotes.name: Norman McSwain

quotes.message: The manager asks how and when; the leader asks what and why.
quotes.name: Warren G. Bennis

quotes.message: Leadership is an art that includes possessing a vision based on unwavering principles, and an ability to inspire and encourage others to be leaders.
quotes.name: W. Jeff Terry

quotes.message: A swift and vigorous transition to attack—the flashing sword of vengeance—is the most brilliant point of the defensive.
quotes.name: Karl von Clausewitz

quotes.message: Leadership is about identifying where you want to go, why it is important to go, and what's in it for others—both the positive and the negative. Leaders lead by example. Leadership is personal. It is working shoulder to shoulder. You must show you are willing to get your hands dirty. You must work at least as hard as those you wish to lead. They eat first. They get sleeping quarters first. You will put yourself at risk, both professionally and physically. Leadership is service before self.
quotes.name: Dr. James P. Bagian

quotes.message: You must lead from the front, always. Speed is everything. There must be a sense of urgency. Listen to the locals. Keep the public informed on the details, they often know more than the Nobel Prize Laureates. Ignore the politics; focus on doing a good job.
quotes.name: Governor Jindal

quotes.message: Leadership is action, not position.
quotes.name: Donald H. McGannon

quotes.message: A good leader is someone who sees beyond themselves and really thinks about how they can move their organization forward by helping others to fulfill their potential.
quotes.name: Sharon Allen

quotes.message: Leadership is hard to define and good leadership even harder. But if you can get people to follow you to the ends of the earth, you are a great leader.
quotes.name: Indra Nooyi

quotes.message: Leadership is a series of behaviors rather than a role for heroes.
quotes.name: Margaret Wheatley

quotes.message: Leadership is something that is learned. It can be learned and should be learned. Leadership is something you're always honing and learning and reflecting to see ways you could have been better at it. Anyone who thinks they're a natural leader is probably horrible to work with.
quotes.name: Rachel Sklar

quotes.message: I want every little girl who's told she is bossy to be told she has leadership skills.
quotes.name: Sheryl Sandburg

quotes.message: Lead from the front; don't push from the rear.
quotes.name: Frances Hesselbein

quotes.message: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
quotes.name: Lao Tzu

quotes.message: I must follow the people.
quotes.name: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.message: A good leader takes a little more than his share of the blame, a little less than his share of the credit.
quotes.name: Arnold Glasow

quotes.message: The first responsibility of a leader is to define reality. The last is to say thank you. In between, the leader is a servant.
quotes.name: Max Depree

quotes.message: Lead me, follow me, or get out of my way.
quotes.name: General George Patton

quotes.message: Unbounded courage and compassion join'd, . Tempering each other in the victor's mind, . Alternately proclaim him good and great, . And make the hero and the man complete.
quotes.name: Joseph Addison

quotes.message: Leadership is leading from the front, saying what needs to be done, doing what needs to be done, inspiring your followers, and persuading your critics.
quotes.name: Richard L. Reece

quotes.message: The six essential leadership attributes: set high standards; live your standards and mentor those who follow; create and share a vision; make the hard choices when necessary; be visible and outfront; and instill hope in those who follow.
quotes.name: John Di Frances

quotes.message: Again and again, an enlightened and strong-willed individual has pushed against the prevailing trends and the prevailing wisdom to perform an act of courage that changed history.
quotes.name: Paul Johnson

quotes.message: The best executive is the one who has sense enough to pick good men to do what he wants done, and self-restraint to keep from meddling with them while they do it.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader works in the open, and the boss in covert. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: The test of leadership is not to put greatness into humanity, but to elicit it, for the greatness is already there.
quotes.name: James Buchanan

quotes.message: Take the ideas of the masses and concentrate them, then go to the masses, persevere in the ideas and carry them through, so as to form correct ideas of leadership—such is the basic method of leadership.
quotes.name: Mao Zedong

quotes.message: Leadership means making people feel good.
quotes.name: Jean Chrétien

quotes.message: Connect before you collaborate. Listen before you lead. Partner before you persuade.
quotes.name: Jo Miller

quotes.message: Leadership includes being able to confidently convey your message and the ability to confidently convey who you are.
quotes.name: Monica L. Wofford

quotes.message: When matters are desperate we must put on a desperate face.
quotes.name: Robert Burns

quotes.message: Desperate times call for desperate measures.
quotes.name: Proverb

quotes.message: Mankind at its most desperate is often at its best.
quotes.name: Bob Geldof

quotes.message: Because I remember, I despair. Because I remember, I have the duty to reject despair.
quotes.name: Elie Wiesel

quotes.message: When a man is in despair, it means that he still believes in something.
quotes.name: Dmitri Shostakovich

quotes.message: The desperate usually succeed because they have nothing to lose.
quotes.name: Jodi Picoult

quotes.message: There is nobody more terrible than the desperate.
quotes.name: Alexander Suvorov

quotes.message: If you are curious, you will learn. If you are desperate, you will discover.
quotes.name: Mooji

quotes.message: Desperation can make a person do surprising things.
quotes.name: Veronica Roth

quotes.message: A starving man won't notice a dirty plate.
quotes.name: Mary Renault

quotes.message: Desperate ills need desperate remedies.
quotes.name: Agatha Christie

quotes.message: When things are desperate, there is no need to pretend that everything is beautiful.
quotes.name: Tenzin Gyatso

quotes.message: Desperation is often more powerful than inspiration.
quotes.name: Debasish Mridha

quotes.message: Desperation is like stealing from the Mafia: you stand a good chance of attracting the wrong attention.
quotes.name: Douglas Horton

quotes.message: Desperate times call for desperate analogies.
quotes.name: John Diamond

quotes.message: When one hits the bottom of the Desperation Barrel, there is always someone down there.
quotes.name: Kelli Jae Baeli

quotes.message: Sometimes that's all life is... One desperate act after another.
quotes.name: Terry Goodkind

quotes.message: There are no desperate situations, there are only desperate people.
quotes.name: Heinz Guderian

quotes.message: Life begins on the other side of despair.
quotes.name: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.message: When the situation is desperate, it is too late to be serious. Be playful.
quotes.name: Edward Abbey

quotes.message: Human beings do not readily admit desperation. When they do, the kingdom of heaven draws near.
quotes.name: Philip Yancey

quotes.message: Beware of desperate steps; the darkest day, lived till tomorrow, will have passed away.
quotes.name: William Cowper

quotes.message: Desperation is a necessary ingredient to learning anything, or creating anything. Period. If you ain't desperate at some point, you ain't interesting.
quotes.name: Jim Carrey

quotes.message: Tempt not a desperate man.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: But desperation is the mother-in-law of invention.
quotes.name: Laura Marney

quotes.message: But a desperate heart will seduce the mind.
quotes.name: Mitch Albom

quotes.message: Desperation makes men fearless.
quotes.name: Jocelyn Murray

quotes.message: Like carnivores to carnal pleasures as are we to desperate measures.
quotes.name: Harvey Danger

quotes.message: When they face desperation... human beings become animals.
quotes.name: Dan Brown

quotes.message: Desperation is sometimes as powerful an inspirer as genius.
quotes.name: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.message: Despair makes victims sometimes victors.
quotes.name: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.message: A dog in desperation will leap over a wall.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverbs

quotes.message: Brilliance is born of Desperation.
quotes.name: Jayanth Komarneni

quotes.message: The greatest inspiration is often born of desperation
quotes.name: Comer Cotrell

quotes.message: That if desperate times call for desperate measures, then I'm free to act as desperately as I wish.
quotes.name: Suzanne Collins

quotes.message: Feeling lost, crazy and desperate belongs to a good life as much as optimism, certainty and reason.
quotes.name: Alain De Botton

quotes.message: Who knows where inspiration comes from. Perhaps it arises from desperation. Perhaps it comes from the flukes of the universe, the kindness of the muses.
quotes.name: Amy Tan

quotes.message: We all need money, but there are degrees of desperation.
quotes.name: Anthony Burgess

quotes.message: Be still, and the world is bound to turn herself inside out to entertain you. Everywhere you look, joyful noise is clanging to drown out quiet desperation.
quotes.name: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.message: Salvation now consists of a deep wrestling in our souls with the sinfulness of our hearts, the depth of our depravity, and the desperation of our need for his grace.
quotes.name: David Platt

quotes.message: Under miserable conditions of life, any vision of the possibility of better things makes the present misery more intolerable, and spurs those who suffer to the most energetic struggles to improve their lot, and if these struggles only immediately result in sharper misery, the outcome is sheer desperation.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: Success is the good fortune that comes from aspiration, desperation, perspiration,and inspiration.
quotes.name: Evan Esar

quotes.message: Don't despair, not even over the fact that you don't despair.
quotes.name: Franz Kafka

quotes.message: Folly and desperation are ofttimes hard to tell apart.
quotes.name: George R. R. Martin

quotes.message: Desperation can toy with you and if you give desperation any wiggle room, it will find alternative answers.
quotes.name: Harlan Coben

quotes.message: Hope means to keep living amid desperation and to keep humming in the darkness.
quotes.name: Henri Nouwen

quotes.message: Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Despair is the price one pays for setting oneself an impossible aim.
quotes.name: Henry Graham Greene

quotes.message: The tragedy of it is that nobody sees the look of desperation on my face. Thousands and thousands of us, and we're passing one another without a look of recognition.
quotes.name: Henry Miller

quotes.message: Every age yearns for a more beautiful world. The deeper the desperation and the depression about the confusing present, the more intense that yearning.
quotes.name: Johan Huizinga

quotes.message: Despair is the damp of hell, as joy is the serenity of heaven.
quotes.name: John Donne

quotes.message: But I'm not here just to make records and money. I'm here to say something and to touch other people, sometimes in a cry of desperation.
quotes.name: Keith Richards

quotes.message: Even in the inevitable moments when all seems hopeless, men know that without hope they cannot really live, and in agonizing desperation, they cry for the bread of hope.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King

quotes.message: Finding permanent and universal causes for misfortune is the practice of despair.
quotes.name: Martin Seligman

quotes.message: Consequences lost all purchase when they became mad. And desperation, when pressed beyond anguish, became narcotic.
quotes.name: R. Scott Bakker

quotes.message: Killing yourself is a major commitment, it takes a kind of courage. Most people just lead lives of cowardly desperation. It's kinda half suicide where you just dull yourself with substances.
quotes.name: Robert Crumb

quotes.message: Despair is not a particularly respectable condition and yet despair and delight alternate like systole and diastole in my heart.
quotes.name: Stephanie Mills

quotes.message: When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: In life you need either inspiration or desperation.
quotes.name: Tony Robbins

quotes.message: Desperation is the raw material of drastic change. Only those who can leave behind everything they have ever believed in can hope to escape.
quotes.name: William S. Burroughs

quotes.message: Beware of driving men to desperation. Even a cornered rat is dangerous.
quotes.name: Winston Churchill

quotes.message: Every time you go out there, you want to be a little nervous, have a little bit of butterflies in your stomach and get the juices flowing.
quotes.name: Taryne Mowatt

quotes.message: Being nervous when talking in front of a lot of people. Sweaty hands, shakey voice, forgetting what your about to say.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: Nervousness always provokes mistakes, and mistakes lead to easy convictions.
quotes.name: S.R. Ford

quotes.message: I'm a very anxious, nervy kind of loser in many ways, and I get very stressed and a little tense.
quotes.name: Ed Weeks

quotes.message: That nervous feeling when you think about that certain someone and how you're about to see them soon.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: Nervous people tend to overreact.
quotes.name: Toba Beta

quotes.message: When you feel nervous, recall your pride.
quotes.name: Toba Beta

quotes.message: If you're not nervous then you're not paying attention.
quotes.name: Miles Davis

quotes.message: One of the symptoms of an approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one's work is terribly important.
quotes.name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.message: To show his nervousness was not shameful; only to admit it.
quotes.name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.message: A well adjusted person is one who makes the same mistake twice without getting nervous.
quotes.name: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.message: Most beginners are too anxious for results. Real progress takes place over a long period of time.
quotes.name: Mary Beth McKenzie

quotes.message: Being nervous actually kept me very tense.
quotes.name: Kate Bush

quotes.message: The way to secure success is to be more anxious about obtaining than about deserving it.
quotes.name: William Hazlitt

quotes.message: The sad truth is that excellence makes people nervous.
quotes.name: Shana Alexander

quotes.message: Time flies when you are anxious!
quotes.name: Maria Bamford

quotes.message: Butterflies in your stomach. More like killer bees.
quotes.name: Kami Garcia

quotes.message: Don't try to be what you're not. If you're nervous, be nervous. If you're shy, be shy. It's cute.
quotes.name: Adriana Lima

quotes.message: The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.
quotes.name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.message: To talk to someone who does not listen is enough to tense the devil.
quotes.name: Pearl Bailey

quotes.message: If you're not nervous, it means you don't care.
quotes.name: Tiger Woods

quotes.message: Being nervous is not something you should be ashamed of. Nervous means you care, you really want to do well.
quotes.name: Paula Creamer

quotes.message: A nervous silence loosens tongues.
quotes.name: Jacqueline Carey

quotes.message: You don't have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
quotes.name: Dan Millman

quotes.message: Nervousness made her feel nauseous, almost like she had two hearts frantically beating in her chest, instead of one.
quotes.name: Caroline Hanson

quotes.message: Sometimes when you're just thrown into something, you are more ready for it than when you have time to think it over and get nervous about it.
quotes.name: Lara Flynn Boyle

quotes.message: When you feel afraid or nervous to do a thing then do it because the real harm which you may thus receive is less poignant than its expectation and fear.
quotes.name: Ali bin Abu-Talib

quotes.message: A bad liver is to a Frenchman what a nervous breakdown is to an American. Everyone has had one and everyone wants to talk about it.
quotes.name: Art Buchwald

quotes.message: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: If I am to meet with a disappointment, the sooner I know it, the more of life I shall have to wear it off.
quotes.name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.message: Disappointment, when it involves neither shame nor loss, is as good as success; for it supplies as many images to the mind, and as many topics to the tongue.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: One's best success comes after their greatest disappointments.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.message: Disappointments are to the soul what a thunderstorm is to the air.
quotes.name: Friedrich Schiller

quotes.message: Disappointment is a good sign of basic intelligence. It cannot be compared to anything else: it is so sharp, precise, obvious, and direct. If we can open, then we suddenly begin to see that our expectations are irrelevant compared with the reality of the situations we are facing.
quotes.name: Chogyam Trungpa

quotes.message: What do you do when disappointment comes? When it weighs on you like a rock, you can either let it press you down until you become discouraged, even devastated, or you can use it as a stepping-stone to better things.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.
quotes.name: Robert Kiyosaki

quotes.message: But you know that disappointment is just the action of your brain readjusting itself to reality after discovering things are not the way you thought they were.
quotes.name: Brad Warner

quotes.message: God makes the life fertile by disappointments, as he makes the ground fertile by frosts.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.message: Let's face it: None of us are ever going to get to the place in life where we have no more disappointments. We can't expect to be sheltered from every little thing. Disappointment is a fact of life--one that must be dealt with.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
quotes.name: Eric Hoffer

quotes.message: Life is not always a celebration; so be ready to courageously face disappointments when they come, and be sure to grow stronger and wiser from them.
quotes.name: Edmond Mbiaka

quotes.message: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.message: Disappointments are a result of failed expectations. To have less disappointments, either expect less from other people or demand more from yourself.
quotes.name: Kevin Ngo

quotes.message: Disappointment is nothing but an eye-opening learning process for your future endeavors.
quotes.name: Edmond Mbiaka

quotes.message: See your disappointments as good fortune. One plan's deflation is another's inflation.
quotes.name: Jean Cocteau

quotes.message: Disappointment or misfortune don't last long among us, the poor; we can't live if we brood on them the whole time.
quotes.name: Viramma Racine

quotes.message: In the midst of my disappointment I am never defeated. Only given the opportunity to rise again willing to take on new challenges.
quotes.name: Eleesha

quotes.message: Disappointments are just God's way of saying I've got something better Be Patient.. Live Life.. Have Faith..
quotes.name: Lanette Sem

quotes.message: Anytime you suffer a setback or disappointment, put your head down and plow ahead.
quotes.name: Les Brown

quotes.message: Disappointment is really just a term for our refusal to look on the bright side.
quotes.name: Richelle E. Goodrich

quotes.message: The simple solution for disappointment depression: Get up and get moving. Physically move. Do. Act. Get going.
quotes.name: Peter McWilliams

quotes.message: Don't let today's disappointments cast a shadow on tomorrow's dreams.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Use disappointments as material for patience.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Every disappointment gives you opportunity to make another appointment.
quotes.name: B. A. Fajimi

quotes.message: It is through disappointment that I must learn to never accept defeat, but to always come up with a brand new plan and find a solution.
quotes.name: Eleesha

quotes.message: High expectations lead to higher disappointments.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
quotes.name: Alexander Pope

quotes.message: Nobody likes being alone that much. I don't go out of my way to make friends, that's all. It just leads to disappointment.
quotes.name: Haruki Murakami

quotes.message: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
quotes.name: William Blake

quotes.message: When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.
quotes.name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.message: Longed for him. Got him. Shit.
quotes.name: Margaret Atwood

quotes.message: There are some things in this world you rely on, like a sure bet. And when they let you down, shifting from where you've carefully placed them, it shakes your faith, right where you stand.
quotes.name: Sarah Dessen

quotes.message: It was one of those times you feel a sense of loss, even though you didn't have something in the first place. I guess that's what disappointment is- a sense of loss for something you never had.
quotes.name: Deb Caletti

quotes.message: Dreaming about being an actress, is more exciting then being one.
quotes.name: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.message: Dreaming about being an actress, is more exciting then being one.
quotes.name: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.message: She wanted none of those days to end, and it was always with disappointment that she watched the darkness stride forward.
quotes.name: Markus Zusak

quotes.message: Life is a long preparation for something that never happens.
quotes.name: W.B. Yeats

quotes.message: If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: He had the look of one who had drunk the cup of life and found a dead beetle at the bottom.
quotes.name: P.G. Wodehouse

quotes.message: Never touch your idols: the gilding will stick to your fingers.
quotes.name: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.message: I aimed at the public's heart, and by accident I hit it in the stomach.
quotes.name: Upton Sinclair

quotes.message: Life is so constructed, that the event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation.
quotes.name: Charlotte Brontë

quotes.message: Disappointments in love, even betrayals and losses, serve the soul at the very moment they seem in life to be tragedies. The soul is partly in time and partly in eternity. We might remember the part that resides in eternity when we feel despair over the part that is in life.
quotes.name: Thomas Moore

quotes.message: But there were worse things than disappointment, and I'd lived through several of them already.
quotes.name: R.J. Anderson

quotes.message: I embraced a cloud, but when I soared it rained.
quotes.name: Frank O'Hara

quotes.message: People who don't expect justice don't have to suffer disappointment.
quotes.name: Isaac Asimov

quotes.message: You can devise all the plans in the world, but if you don’t welcome spontaneity; you will just disappoint yourself.
quotes.name: Abigail Biddinger

quotes.message: Hope isn't destiny. Left passive its nothing more than disappointment deferred.
quotes.name: Bill Willingham

quotes.message: Expectation has brought me disappointment. Disappointment has brought me wisdom. Acceptance, gratitude and appreciation have brought me joy and fulfillment.
quotes.name: Rasheed Ogunlaru

quotes.message: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
quotes.name: Sir Boyle Roche

quotes.message: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret or disappointment.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: Disenchantment, whether it is a minor disappointment or a major shock, is the signal that things are moving into transition in our lives.
quotes.name: William Throsby Bridges

quotes.message: Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything.
quotes.name: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.message: Depression begins with disappointment. When disappointment festers in our soul, it leads to discouragement.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King

quotes.message: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don’t try.
quotes.name: Beverly Sills

quotes.message: The sudden disappointment of a hope leaves a scar which the ultimate fulfillment of that hope never entirely removes.
quotes.name: Thomas Hardy

quotes.message: If you think one day you will get it all done, and then you can relax, you are bound to be disappointed.
quotes.name: Christina Winsey-Rudd

quotes.message: Men marry because they are tired, women, because they are curious: both are disappointed.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: Perfectionism rarely begets perfection, or satisfaction – only disappointment.
quotes.name: Ryan Holiday

quotes.message: The beauty is that through disappointment you can gain clarity, and with clarity comes conviction and true originality.
quotes.name: Conan O’Brien

quotes.message: Hope is tomorrow’s veneer over today’s disappointment.
quotes.name: Evan Esar

quotes.message: Blessed is he that expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.
quotes.name: Thomas S. Monson

quotes.message: There’s always failure. And there’s always disappointment. And there’s always loss. But the secret is learning from the loss, and realizing that none of those holes are vacuums.
quotes.name: Michael J. Fox

quotes.message: Enthusiasm is followed by disappointment and even depression, and then by renewed enthusiasm.
quotes.name: Murray Gell-Mann

quotes.message: Sometimes Good Things Fall Apart So Better Things Can Fall Together.
quotes.name: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.message: To courageously straighten up again after our heads have been bowed by defeat, disappointment and suffering is a supreme test of character.
quotes.name: Wilferd Peterson

quotes.message: When we focus on our gratitude, the tide of disappointment goes out and the tide of love rushes in.
quotes.name: Kristin Armstrong

quotes.message: A scheme of which every part promises delight, can never be successful; and general disappointment is only warded off by the defense of some little peculiar vexation.
quotes.name: Jane Austen

quotes.message: The price of excellence is discipline; the cost of mediocrity is disappointment.
quotes.name: William Arthur Ward

quotes.message: Our role as leaders is to turn away from our disappointment and abandonment, and give ourselves to those with whom we still have influence.
quotes.name: Costa Mitchell

quotes.message: Nothing in life has happened to you. It's happened for you. Every disappointment. Every wrong. Even every closed door has helped make you into who you are.
quotes.name: Joel Osteen

quotes.message: God is the only source of hope that'll never disappoint. When we place our faith in him, he provides joy, peace, and hope that overflows.
quotes.name: Rick Warren

quotes.message: There is space within sisterhood for likeness and differences, for the subtle differences that challenge and delight; there is space for disappointment - and surprise.
quotes.name: Christine Downing

quotes.message: It is cruel, you know, that music should be so beautiful. It has the beauty of loneliness of pain: of strength and freedom. The beauty of disappointment and never-satisfied love. The cruel beauty of nature and everlasting beauty of monotony.
quotes.name: Benjamin Britten

quotes.message: My dad encouraged us to fail. Growing up, he would ask us what we failed at that week. If we didn't have something, he would be disappointed. It changed my mindset at an early age that failure is not the outcome, failure is not trying. Don't be afraid to fail.
quotes.name: Sara Blakely

quotes.message: If you don’t encounter setbacks in your career, if you don’t have doubts and disappointments , let me tell you, you’re not dreaming big enough.
quotes.name: Michael Bloomberg

quotes.message: Reality is the name we give to our disappointments.
quotes.name: Mason Cooley

quotes.message: Man alone is born crying, lives complaining, and dies disappointed.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: We are born crying, live complaining, and die disappointed.
quotes.name: Thomas Fuller

quotes.message: If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed.
quotes.name: Sylvia Plath

quotes.message: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.message: Never despair, but if you do, work on in despair.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: Vote for the man who promises least; he’ll be the least disappointing.
quotes.name: Bernard M. Baruch

quotes.message: I’d rather be pleasantly surprised than fatally disappointed.
quotes.name: Julia Glass

quotes.message: It is not defeat that destroys you,it is being demoralized by defeat that destroy you.
quotes.name: Imran Khan

quotes.message: Enlightenment is ego’s ultimate disappointment.
quotes.name: Chogyam Trungpa

quotes.message: The disappointment of manhood succeeds the delusion of youth.
quotes.name: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.message: One minute of sincere gratitude can wash away a lifetime’s disappointments.
quotes.name: Silvia Hartmann

quotes.message: Sometimes when you get disappointment it makes you stronger.
quotes.name: Daid Rudisha

quotes.message: Blessed is he who expects no gratitude, for he shall not be disappointed.
quotes.name: W.C. Bennett

quotes.message: One of the best protections against disappointment is to have a lot going on.
quotes.name: Alain De Botton

quotes.message: Opportunity is a favorable occasion for grasping a disappointment.
quotes.name: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.message: The prompter the refusal, the less the disappointment.
quotes.name: Publilius Syrus

quotes.message: Mean spirits under disappointment, like small beer in a thunder- storm, always turn sour.
quotes.name: Randolph

quotes.message: The magic isn't in getting married, it's in staying married.
quotes.name: Derek Luke

quotes.message: Getting married and settling down isn't the most important thing in my life.
quotes.name: Liam Neeson

quotes.message: Writing is like getting married. One should never commit oneself until one is amazed at one's luck.
quotes.name: Iris Murdoch

quotes.message: My advice to you is to get married. If you find a good wife, you'll be happy; if not, you'll become a philosopher.
quotes.name: Socrates

quotes.message: Come, let's be a comfortable couple and take care of each other! How glad we shall be, that we have somebody we are fond of always, to talk to and sit with.
quotes.name: Charles Dickens

quotes.message: Love seems the swiftest but it is the slowest of all growths. No man or woman really knows what perfect love is until they have been married a quarter of a century.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Getting married isn't going to make your relationship better. It's just a ceremony.
quotes.name: Rob Lowe

quotes.message: When you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody, you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
quotes.name: Nora Ephron

quotes.message: I guess walking slow getting married is because it gives you time to maybe change your mind.
quotes.name: Virginia Cary Hudson

quotes.message: Getting married is like putting one's hand in a bag containing 99 serpents and one eel.
quotes.name: Thomas More

quotes.message: Getting married was a ball. Being married was a nightmare.
quotes.name: Kid Rock

quotes.message: When I get married I'm going to make the marriage work. Getting married is forever, no matter what my spouse does.
quotes.name: Sarah Mlynowski

quotes.message: Nowadays it's hip not to be married. I'm not interested in being hip.
quotes.name: John Lennon

quotes.message: If he's getting married, he's not longer interesting.
quotes.name: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

quotes.message: If I get married, I want to be very married.
quotes.name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.message: Don't marry the person you think you can live with; marry only the individual you think you can't live without.
quotes.name: James C. Dobson

quotes.message: Make it your goal to create a marriage that feels like the safest place on earth.
quotes.name: Greg Smalley

quotes.message: Getting married is a lot like getting into a tub of hot water. After you get used to it, it ain't so hot.
quotes.name: Minnie Pearl

quotes.message: Getting married is easy. Staying married is more difficult. Staying happily married for a lifetime should rank among the fine arts.
quotes.name: Roberta Flack

quotes.message: Getting married is very much like going to a restaurant with friends. You order what you want then when you see what the other person has, you wish you had ordered that.
quotes.name: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.message: You don't marry one person; you marry three: the person you think they are, the person they are, and the person they are going to become as a result of being married to you.
quotes.name: Richard Needham

quotes.message: If you get married, you lose all your benefits. That's insane! We should give people bonuses for getting married, and sending signals and talking about it to the society.
quotes.name: Sam Brownback

quotes.message: Instead of getting married again, I'm going to find a woman I don't like and give her a house.
quotes.name: Lewis Grizzard

quotes.message: Don't marry a man unless you would be proud to have a son exactly like him.
quotes.name: Katie Ray Blair

quotes.message: I think that, on some level, everybody lives vicariously through couples who are getting married.
quotes.name: Amy Dickinson

quotes.message: People today expect too much from marriage. Getting married is really like taking on a big new job.
quotes.name: Rosamunde Pilcher

quotes.message: Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do.
quotes.name: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quotes.message: Getting married is the boldest and most idealistic thing that most of us will ever do.
quotes.name: Maggie Gallagher

quotes.message: I think getting married gave me a focus. It gave me a focus and direction I want to have in my life. And I think having another person that you make such a purposeful bond with has given me the opportunity to see how that can be with all the other aspects of my life.
quotes.name: Selma Blair

quotes.message: For me, getting married doesn't mean we should limit ourselves to some pre-defined idea. Rather, it's an opportunity to explore new things in life.
quotes.name: Jessica Biel

quotes.message: For many, many people, getting married is one of the most important things they will ever do in the pursuit of happiness.
quotes.name: Marianne Williamson

quotes.message: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
quotes.name: Mignon McLaughlin

quotes.message: Grow old with me! The best is yet to be.
quotes.name: Robert Browning

quotes.message: The surest way to be alone is to get married.
quotes.name: Gloria Steinem

quotes.message: Getting married, for me, was the best thing I ever did. I was suddenly beset with an immense sense of release, that we have something more important than our separate selves, and that is the marriage. There's immense happiness that can come from working towards that.
quotes.name: Nick Cave

quotes.message: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Getting married and starting a family has been a lifelong goal and one that I have persevered through different paths up to it!
quotes.name: Alanis Morissette

quotes.message: Getting married is like trading in the adoration of many for the sarcasm of one.
quotes.name: Mae West

quotes.message: If you're getting married less you're getting less divorces.
quotes.name: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.message: Getting married and really digging in with another human being can point out your greatest strengths and your greatest weaknesses.
quotes.name: Mat Kearney

quotes.message: Getting married is an incredible act of hopefulness.
quotes.name: Ashley Judd

quotes.message: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
quotes.name: Andy Warhol

quotes.message: Things do not change; we change.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Nothing endures but change.
quotes.name: Heraclitus

quotes.message: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
quotes.name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.message: Things alter for the worse spontaneously, if they be not altered for the better designedly.
quotes.name: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.message: He that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils; for time is the greatest innovator.
quotes.name: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.message: When you are through changing, you are through.
quotes.name: Bruce Barton

quotes.message: Consider how hard it is to change yourself and you'll understand what little chance you have in trying to change others.
quotes.name: Jacob M Braude

quotes.message: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.message: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.message: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
quotes.name: Gandhi

quotes.message: There is a certain relief in change, even though it be from bad to worse! As I have often found in travelling in a stagecoach, that it is often a comfort to shift one's position, and be bruised in a new place.
quotes.name: Washington Irving

quotes.message: The man who looks for security, even in the mind, is like a man who would chop off his limbs in order to have artificial ones which will give him no pain or trouble.
quotes.name: Henry Miller

quotes.message: We are chameleons, and our partialities and prejudices change place with an easy and blessed facility, and we are soon wonted to the change and happy in it.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: He who rejects change is the architect of decay. The only human institution which rejects progress is the cemetery.
quotes.name: Harold Wilson

quotes.message: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything -- or nothing.
quotes.name: Lady Nancy Astor

quotes.message: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
quotes.name: Marcus Aelius Aurelius

quotes.message: It is a secret both in nature and state, that it is safer to change many things than one.
quotes.name: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.message: Not everything that is faced can be changed. But nothing can be changed until it is faced.
quotes.name: James Arthur Baldwin

quotes.message: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.
quotes.name: Joel Barker

quotes.message: I have my faults, but changing my tune is not one of them.
quotes.name: Samuel Beckett

quotes.message: If a man die, shall he live again? All the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.
quotes.name: Job 14:14

quotes.message: Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family.
quotes.name: Anthony Brandt

quotes.message: We must all obey the great law of change. It is the most powerful law of nature.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: Look abroad through Nature's range, Nature's mighty law is change.
quotes.name: Robert Burns

quotes.message: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
quotes.name: Winston Churchill

quotes.message: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: Can anybody remember when the times were not hard and money not scarce?
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: There is in the worst of fortune the best of chances for a happy change.
quotes.name: Euripides

quotes.message: It is not strange ... to mistake change for progress.
quotes.name: Millard Fillmore

quotes.message: One must never lose time in vainly regretting the past or in complaining against the changes which cause us discomfort, for change is the essence of life.
quotes.name: Anatole France

quotes.message: He who shall introduce into public affairs the principles of primitive Christianity will change the face of the world.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.
quotes.name: Robert Lee Frost

quotes.message: The tiger can't change his spots. No, wait, he did! Good for him!
quotes.name: Jack Handey

quotes.message: In times like these, it is helpful to remember that there have always been times like these.
quotes.name: Paul Harvey

quotes.message: In a time of drastic change, it is the learners who inherit the future. The learned find themselves equipped to live in a world which no longer exists.
quotes.name: Eric Hoffer

quotes.message: Don't knock the weather; nine-tenths of the people couldn't start a conversation if it didn't change once in a while.
quotes.name: Kin Hubbard

quotes.message: Perhaps nothing has changed in the course of history as much as historians.
quotes.name: Franklin P Jones

quotes.message: Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city, it might be better to change the locks.
quotes.name: Doug Larson

quotes.message: The real sadness of fifty is not that you change so much but that you change so little.
quotes.name: Max Lerner

quotes.message: If you want truly to understand something, try to change it.
quotes.name: Kurt Lewin

quotes.message: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes the furthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: A wish changes nothing. A decision changes everything.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: You start with a darkness to move through but sometimes the darkness moves through you.
quotes.name: Dean Young

quotes.message: Life is at its best when everything has fallen out of place, and you decide that you're going to fight to get them right, not when everything is going your way and everyone is praising you.
quotes.name: Thisuri Wanniarachchi

quotes.message: Faith is why I'm here today and faith is why I made it through.
quotes.name: Jonathan Anthony Burkett

quotes.message: You need to spend time crawling alone through shadows to truly appreciate what it is to stand in the sun.
quotes.name: Shaun Hick

quotes.message: Life is hard for everyone. That's why there's such a nice reward at the end of it.
quotes.name: Aidan Quinn

quotes.message: If you would only recognize that life is hard, things would be so much easier for you.
quotes.name: Louis D. Brandeis

quotes.message: My philosophy is: Life is hard, but God is good. Try not to confuse the two.
quotes.name: Anne F. Beiler

quotes.message: Life is hard. It is not too short, it is too long. But you have to learn how to live; you have to have a sense of humour.
quotes.name: Carolina Herrera

quotes.message: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.
quotes.name: Katharine Hepburn

quotes.message: We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
quotes.name: Kenji Miyazawa

quotes.message: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
quotes.name: Henry Ford

quotes.message: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
quotes.name: Robert Schuller

quotes.message: Pain is your friend; it is your alie. Pain reminds you to finish the job and get the hell home. Pain tells you when you have been seriously wounded.
quotes.name: G.I. Jane

quotes.message: Tough times never last, but tough people do.
quotes.name: Robert H Schuller

quotes.message: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
quotes.name: Duke Ellington

quotes.message: I ask not for a lighter burden, but for broader shoulders.
quotes.name: Jewish Proverb

quotes.message: One who gains strength by overcoming obstacles possesses the only strength which can overcome adversity.
quotes.name: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.message: Life is not always fair. Sometimes you get a splinter sliding down a rainbow.
quotes.name: Terri Guillemets

quotes.message: Nothing good comes cheaply so we shouldn't be surprised when we meet the hard while going for the best. Hard times are not quit times.
quotes.name: Terry Mark

quotes.message: The last battle always seems the toughest and to give up will always bring the worst defeat.
quotes.name: Terry Mark

quotes.message: Don't pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
quotes.name: Bruce Lee

quotes.message: The hardest thing to learn in life is which bridge to cross and which to burn.
quotes.name: David Russell

quotes.message: If you're already in a hole, it is no use to continue digging.
quotes.name: Roy W. Walters

quotes.message: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
quotes.name: Thomas Edison

quotes.message: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.message: It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
quotes.name: Edmund Hillary

quotes.message: It always seems impossible until it's done.
quotes.name: Nelson Mandela

quotes.message: When I hear somebody sigh, Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, Compared to what '
quotes.name: Sydney J. Harris

quotes.message: Life is hard and it gets worse and worse and worse.
quotes.name: Cat Power

quotes.message: And hard times are good in their own way, too. Because the only way you can achieve true happiness is if you experience true sadness as well. It's all about light and shade. Balance.
quotes.name: Gabrielle Williams

quotes.message: Life is hard enough without someone walking into your life on purpose and making it worse.
quotes.name: Pauley Perrette

quotes.message: I'll tell you something about tough times. They just about kill you, but if you decide to keep working at them, you'll find your way through.
quotes.name: Joan Bauer

quotes.message: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
quotes.name: Moliere

quotes.message: But that's the challenge-to change the system more than it changes you.
quotes.name: Michael Pollan

quotes.message: The key to life is accepting challenges. Once someone stops doing this, he's dead.
quotes.name: Bette Davis

quotes.message: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
quotes.name: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: We all want things to stay the same. Settle for living in misery because we are afraid of change, of things crumbling to ruins. Ruin is a gift. Ruin is the road to transformation.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.message: When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this: you haven't.
quotes.name: Thomas Edison

quotes.message: Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.
quotes.name: J.K. Rowling

quotes.message: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hang on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
quotes.name: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quotes.message: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea.
quotes.name: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.message: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.
quotes.name: Robert Fulghum

quotes.message: You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
quotes.name: Walt Disney

quotes.message: In the midst of winter, I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: Adversity is like a strong wind. It tears away from us all but the things that cannot be torn, so that we see ourselves as we really are.
quotes.name: Arthur Golden

quotes.message: Life is very simple: it merely consists in learning how to accept the impossible, how to do without the indispensable, how to endure the insupportable.
quotes.name: Kathleen Norris

quotes.message: Life is a crowded superhighway with bewildering cloverleaf exits on which a man is liable to find himself speeding back in the direction he came.
quotes.name: Peter De Vries

quotes.message: As I grow to understand life less and less, I learn to love it more and more.
quotes.name: Jules Renard

quotes.message: Life is a hospital in which every patient wants to change his bed for another's.
quotes.name: Baudelaire

quotes.message: It is impossible to cheat life; there are no answers to the problems of life in the back of the book.
quotes.name: Kierkegaard

quotes.message: He has spent his life best who has enjoyed it most; God will take care that we do not enjoy it any more than is good for us.
quotes.name: Samuel Butler

quotes.message: Many people who spend their time mourning over the brevity of life, could make it seem longer if they did a little more work.
quotes.name: Don Marquis

quotes.message: Life seems to be divided into two periods: in the first we indulge, in the second we preach.
quotes.name: Will Durant

quotes.message: We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from it.
quotes.name: William Osler

quotes.message: It is not true that life is one damn thing after another: it's one damn thing over and over.
quotes.name: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quotes.message: The life of a man in this world is like the life of a fly in a room filled with a hundred boys, each armed with a flyswatter.
quotes.name: Mencken

quotes.message: About the time we learn how to make the most of life, most of it is gone.
quotes.name: Evan Esar

quotes.message: Life is generally made up of three things: pretense, suspense. and expense.
quotes.name: Evan Esar

quotes.message: Life is a matter about which we are lost if we reason either too much or too little.
quotes.name: Samuel Butler

quotes.message: Life is no laughing matter, except to the man who can laugh at his troubles.
quotes.name: Evan Esar

quotes.message: When a person puts his best foot forward and gets it stepped on-that's life.
quotes.name: Evan Esar

quotes.message: Life consists not in holding good cards, but in playing well those you do hold.
quotes.name: Josh Billings

quotes.message: Life is painting a picture, not doing a sum.
quotes.name: Justice O.W. Holmes

quotes.message: Your decisions influence how you will live the remainder of you life.
quotes.name: John A. Andrews

quotes.message: Life moves swiftly, and you need to act before you're acted upon.
quotes.name: John A. Andrews

quotes.message: Life is not divided into semesters. You don't get summers off and very few employers are interested in helping you find yourself.
quotes.name: Vincenzo Berghella

quotes.message: In real life, people actually have to leave the coffee shop and go to jobs.
quotes.name: Vincenzo Berghella

quotes.message: The refusal to accept suffering as a natural part of life can lead to viewing oneself as a perpetual victim and blaming others for our problems.
quotes.name: Rudolph Giuliani

quotes.message: Whether you suffer depends on how you respond to a given situation.
quotes.name: Rudolph Giuliani

quotes.message: Every problem is an opportunity in disguise.
quotes.name: Jason K. Baxter

quotes.message: Adversity reveals genius. Prosperity conceals it.
quotes.name: Horatius

quotes.message: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.
quotes.name: Gail Sheehy

quotes.message: We may counter many defeats, but we must not be defeated.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: When life knocks you down, try to land on your back. Because if you can look up, you can get up.
quotes.name: Les Brown

quotes.message: You don't make your character in a crises; you exhibit it.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: The darker the night, the sweetest the victory.
quotes.name: Bill Clinton

quotes.message: One must not be afraid of being hurt. The world is full of all kinds of hurts and it is only by facing them that we can become strong and hardy.
quotes.name: Indira Gandhi

quotes.message: There are millions of people in the world but most of them just drift along, afraid of death and even more afraid of life.
quotes.name: Indira Gandhi

quotes.message: Hard times can mean no money.
quotes.name: Andrew Matthews

quotes.message: Hard times can mean no friends, no job, no hope.
quotes.name: Andrew Matthews

quotes.message: Sometimes life is hard. How do you hang on when things seem hopeless? You can tackle your problems as you would climb a mountain.
quotes.name: Andrew Matthews

quotes.message: Through hard times. It puts your life into perspective. It will get you back on track.
quotes.name: Andrew Matthews

quotes.message: We will all have setbacks in life--not maybe, not might, but for sure. We will all have setbacks in life. Both success and failure are decisions. Once your vision is in place, you need to decide you're going to win despite the setback.
quotes.name: Willie Jolley

quotes.message: Where you put your focus and your energy will determine where you will go. If you focus on the setback and challenges it brought you, you cannot effectively move forward.
quotes.name: Willie Jolley
